frames.text: Ha kaona-onaan nan panaon, pinalhwa nan Apo Dioh ye langit boy lota. Ha hatew, ahe po angkakit ye babe lota ta pawa nin lanom boy maliteh. Hiyay Ihpidito nan Dioh a bilang angin, anti ya ha babe lanom.

Haanin, hinabi nin Apo Dioh,a wana, “Magkamain mahnag.” Ha hinabi na yatew, hinomnag ana. “Manged ti mahnag,” wanan Apo Dioh. Hiyay mahnag, pinangalanan nan mangaamot. Hiyay maliteh met, pinanglanan na yan madeglem. Haanin, nalabah anay onan mangaamot.
Ikalwan mangaamot, hiyay lanom, pinayngihiyay nan Apo Dioh. Hiyay kagitna, impalakew na ha matag-ay boy kanan yatew, nag-ilyadin oep. Hiyay lanom a anti ihti ha aypa, pinangalanan na yan dagat.
Ikatlon mangaamot, pinayngihiyay nan Apo Dioh ye lanom a anti ihti ha aypa omon ya lomwah ye lota.
Ha nilomwah ye lota, hinabi nan Apo Dioh,a wana, “Hiyay lota, toboan yan ilamon, kayo, boy tamanan a ampandawa nin malyadin pangwaan bini.” Haanin, nalyadin yati a hinabi nan Apo Dioh.

Ikaapat a mangaamot, hinabi nan Apo Dioh a magkamain mangaamot ha langit a mamiay nin mahnag ha babe lota. Hinabi na po a magkamain boan ha langit boy bito-en a mamiay nin mahnag ha babe lota. Yabayti ye hinabi nan Apo Dioh ket nalyadi yayna.

Ikaliman mangaamot, hinabi nan Apo Dioh a magkamain mangayadet a ikan boy magkamain nin tobat a kalabongan malanghit a angkabi-ay ha lanom. Hinabi na po nin Apo Dioh a magkamain nin hadihadi a manok a anlompad. Ha nayadi yayna yabaytew, hinabi na kanla,a wana, “Manganak kawo omon kawo lomabong.”

Ikaanem a mangaamot, hinabi nan Apo Dioh a magkamain nin ayop a omon ha baka, damwag, kabayo, oyha, bake, baboy, bikat, aho, koting, boy kaganaan a kalahi a ayop a angkakit tao haanin ha babe lota. Ha nakit nin Apo Dioh yati a dinyag na, naaliket ya.

Haanin, hiyay Apo Dioh, hinabi na,a wana, “Manyag akoynan tao.” Ha nayadi nan hinabi yatew, nangwa yan lota a diagen nan laman nin tao. Onan dinimeng na kanan yatew a lota kete ō, mata, talinga, bebey, balongoh, gamet, boy bitih. Ha nayadi na yan dinyag, ineyepan nay balongoh na ta omon yayna magkamain nin bi-ay.

Haanin, pinakatoloy na yay tao. Yabayti yay tao a onan dinyag nan Apo Dioh ket laki ya. Pinangalanan na yan Adan. Haanin, hiyay Apo Dioh, nanyag yan matampa a logal a konaan nan Adan omon na yan mabantayan a manged.ye Iden ye ngalan nan yabaytew a logal. Ha hatew, hilay ayop a pinalhwa nan Apo Dioh, inlakew na hila kanan Adan ta hiyay Adan ye mamiay nin ngalan kanlan balang magha  kanla .

Ha bonak nin yabaytew a logal, main loay poon kayo. Hiyay magha, ampamiay bi-ay, hiyay magha, ampamiay tinanda tongkol ha manged boy maloke. Haanin, hinabi nin Apo Dioh kanla,a wana, “Hiyay dawa nin kaganaan a kayo ihti, malyadi yon kanen, noba hiyay dawa nin kayon ampamiay tinanda tongkol ha manged boy maloke, ahe yo angkanen, ta no mangan kawon dawa nin yain, akayo matey kawo.”
Haanin, hinabi nan Apo Dioh, a wana, “Aliwan manged a hiyay tao, bobokod na. Kaya-bay manyag ako nin pagkalamo nan Adan.”
Haanin, hiyay Adan, pinakatoloy na yan Apo Dioh nin maiplek, bayo ya nangoyoh nin maghay tagyang nan Adan ta dinyag na yan babayi. Ha nimata yay Adan, nakit na  a main yaynan kalamo.
Matampa a babayi ye dinyag nan Apo Dioh. Naaliket yay Adan ta main yaynan kalamo. Ket Eva ye impangalan nan Adan kanan babayin pagkalamo na.
Haanin, hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanla, a wana, “Magpakalabong kawo boy hikao ye manalima ha kaganaan a aayop. Bian kataon kanen yo boy kanen nin aayop.”

Ikapiton mangaamot, hiyay Apo Dioh, nagpainawa ya ta nayadi nayna ye dinyag na.**Tema: Kapalyadiyan nan Apo Dioh****Tetepet:**  - Hinyay malyadi tawon makit ha kapalyadiyan nan Apo Dioh?  - Kaganaan a pinalhwa nan Apo Dioh, hinabi na a manged ya. No wanabay ye ihip nan Apo Dioh, way-omen ye ihip na tongkol kantawon Ayta?  - Hinyay labay nan Apo Dioh a diyagen tawo ha ikapiton mangaamot?**Tongkol kanan Apo Jesus:**"Makaoli kanan Apo Jesus, pinalhowa nay kaganaan a anti ha langit boykaganaan a anti ihti ha babe lota. Pinalhwa nay kaganaan a angkakitboy kaganaan a ahe angkakit a omen kanlan ihpiditon ampanakop boyampamaala kanlan ampamoon boy ihpiditon main kapalyadiyan. Bayonapalhowa ye hinyaman a babagay ihti ha babe lota, ket anti yaynayApo Jesu Cristo. Ket makaoli kana, ampagpaholong a magnap yekaganaan a anti ha babe lota." (Colosas 1:16-17)
Hiyay lāki boy babai, padiho hilan loh-ok boy homain hilan paykadingey.

Haanin, hiyay Satanas, nag-ilyadi yan bikat. Magaling yan manyag dān palakew ha kalok-an. Ket hiyay Satanas, nakit na yay Eva a homain lamo. Ket hinomaley ya kana ta hinabi na, a wana, “Hiyay Apo Dioh nayi ye ampangibawal kanyon mangan nin dawan kayo ha kaganaan a kakayon anti ihtin logal?”

Hiyay babai a nag-ngalan Eva, nakibat ya, a wana, “Hiyay dawa nin kaganaan a kakayo, malyadi mi yan kanen. Noba hiyay dawa nin yain a kayon ampamiay tinanda nin tongkol ha manged boy maloke, ahe mi ya malyadin kanen boy ahe mi ya malyadin kadtanan ta hinabi nin Apo Dioh a no mangan kayin yain a dawa ket matey kayi.”
Haanin, hinabi nan bikat kanan Eva, wana, “Ahe kawo matey no mangan kawo nin kanan yain a dawa. Ket no mangan kawo kanan yain a dawa, matandaan yo ye manged boy maloke a omon kanan Dioh.”
Haanin ha nakit nan Eva yatew a matampa a dawa ket namoti yan magha ta kinan na. Nangwa ya po maghan dawa ta ipakan na met kanan Adan a lamo na.
Ha nayadi hilan nangan nin yabaytew a dawan kayo, natandaan layna a loh-ok hila. Ket nangwa hilan boong kayo ta tinayi la a pamahanip ha laman la.

Ha pahilem, nange la ye tonoy nan Apo Dioh. Hiyay Adan boy hiyay Eva, nanandali hilan napaytayo ha popoonnin kakayo. Noba nange la ye tonoy nan Apo Dioh, a wana, “Adan, way-ihtew ka?” Nakibat yay Adan, wana, “Anti ko ihti a ampagtayo. Angkalimo ko kamo boy angkadingey ako ta loh-ok ako.”

Haanin, tinepet na yan Apo Dioh, a wana, “Hinyay naghabi kamo a loh-ok ka? Nangan ka nayi nin dawan kayonimbawal ko kanyon kanen?" Nakibat yay Adan, wana, "Hiyay babayi a in-ibiay mon paglamo ko, hiyabay ti namiaykangkon dawa a kinan ko.” Hinabi nin Apo Dioh kanan Eva, a wana, “Taket ta dinyag moy wanabay?” Nakibat yay Eva, a wana, “Niloko na kon bikat ta pinakwa na kon dawan kayo ket kinan ko.”

Hinabi nin Apo Dioh ha bikat, wana, “Aliwan manged ye dinyag mo. Kayabay paibat haanin, hiyay bitoka mo ye ikodang mo. Hika boy yatin babayi, paykabonoen ko. Hiyay anak nan yatin babayi, hiyabay ye mamokpok nin ō mo ket hika, mangapa kan mangayat ha bitih na.”
Haanin, hinabi nan Apo Dioh ha babayi, wana, “Mag-idap kan mang-anak. Pahakop ka ha ahawa mo boy manombong ka kana.”

Hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanan lāki, a wana, “Nanlenge ka ha ahawa mo boy nangan kan yabaytew a dawan kayo a imbawalko kamon kanen. Kaya-bay paibat haanin, manaynget kan mag-obda ha pagbi-ay yon minamangaamot. Malabong a didiwih ye tomobo ha lota a mamaidap kamo. Hiyay laman mon ibat ha lota ket mag-odong ya met ateed ha lota.” Haanin, hiyay Apo Dioh, nanyag yan pagtapih la a niyadi ha katat nin ayop.

Hinabi na po nin Apo Dioh, a wana, “Hiyay tao haanin, omon yayna kantawo ta oli ha kahalanan la, nagkamain hilan tinanda a tongkol ha manged boy maloke. Ket haanin, omon hila ahe makakan nin dawa nin hiyatin a kayo a ampamiay bi-ay, paalihen ko hila ihtin logal,” wanan Apo Dioh.**Tema: Mapatayaan yay Apo Dioh ha papangako na****Tetepet:**1. Imbilin nan Apo Dioh kanan Abram a lakwanan nay Haran ta makewya ha logal itodo na kana. Hinyay babagay a an-itodo nan Apo Dioh alakwanan mo?2. Hinyay malyadi tawon maadal ha bi-ay nan Abraham tongkol ha pang-agad sa pangako nan Apo Dioh?3. Hinyay mangaidap a babagay a an-ipadyag nan Apo Dioh kammo?Main ka laweh pamteg a omen kanan Abraham?**Tongkol kanan Apo Jesus:**"Hiyay Manged a Balita a imbalita nan Apo Dioh kanan Abraham,wanae ya, “Makaoli kamo, biyan ko hilan kangedan ye tatao hakaganaan a nanahyon.” (Galatia 3:8)

Many years later, many people were living in the world. They had become very wicked and violent. It became so bad that God decided to destroy the whole world with a huge flood.Kananyatew a panaon, malabong anan tataon anti ihtibay ha babe lota. Hiyay Apo Dioh, nakit na hilay kaganaan a tatao a ahe anan ampanyag nin kangedan ta pawa anan kalok-an ye andiagen la.

But Noah found grace in God’s eyes. He was the only righteous man among all the wicked people. God told Noah about the flood He was planning to send. He told Noah to build a huge boat called an ark.Homain anan kanayon a ampanggalang kanan Apo Dioh no aliwan hiyay Nowin bengat. Hiyay Nowi, ampanopad ya kanan Apo Dioh boy angkalimo yan manyag maloke ta ampanggalang ya kanan Apo Dioh. Tatlo hilay lālaki a aanak nan Nowi. Hiyay ngalan la: Sem, Cam, boy Jafet.  Haanin, hiyay Apo Dioh, inhabi na kanan Nowi, a wana, “Hilay tatao haanin, maloke hilayna. Kaya-bay lanaben koy babe lota ta omon hilaynan matey.”

God told Noah to make the boat about 140 meters long, 23 meters wide, and 13.5 meters high. It was to be made of wood and have three levels, many rooms, a roof, and a window. The boat would keep Noah, his family, and two of every kind of animal safe during the flood.“Noba bayo ko lanaben ye babe lota, manyag ka po nin mayadet a bangka a hakyan yo a ahe mahlepan nin lanom. Hiyay bangka a diagen mo, apat a gatoh boy limampo a mitodo ti kaway na.

Noah obeyed God. He and his three sons built the boat just the way God had told them. It took many years to build the boat, because it was so big. Noah warned the people about the coming flood and told them to turn to God, but they just laughed at him.Pahakayen moy ahawa mo boy tatloy aanak mo boy aahawa la ta omon kawo mayligtah.”

Noah and his family also gathered enough food for themselves and the animals. When everything was ready, God told Noah it was time for him, his wife, his three sons, and their wives to get into the boat—eight people in all.Ha nayadi anay bangka, hinabi nin Apo Dioh kanan Nowi, a wana, “Homakay kawoyna ha bangka,” wana.

God sent a male and a female of every animal and bird to Noah so they could go into the boat and be kept safe during the flood. God sent seven males and seven females of every type of animal which could be used for sacrifices. When they were all in the boat, God Himself closed the door.“Ha kaganaan a kalahin aayop, mangwa kan maghay padih ta ihakay mo hila ha bangka, noba pitoy padih ye kowen mo ha kaganaan a kalahin aayop a malyadin mon maydigalo kangko. Mangikalga kawon malabong a pamamangan yo boy pamamangan lan hilain a aayop.”

Then it began to rain, and rain, and rain. It rained for forty days and forty nights without stopping! Water also came gushing up out of the earth. Everything in the whole world was covered with water, even the highest mountains.Haanin, ha nakahakay hilayna, hiyay polta nin yabaytew a bangka, inleneb na yan Apo Dioh. Pagkayadi yatew, nangodan yaynan nang-odan, mangaamot boy madeglem angga ha maabot ye apatapo a mangaamot.

Everything that lived on the dry land died, except the people and animals who were in the boat. The boat floated on the water and everything inside the boat was kept safe.Hiyay babe lota, natagpenan nin lanom. Ket hilay mangapapantay, ahe anan makit. Naoboh anan natey ye kaganaan a tataon ahe namteg kanan Apo Dioh. Ket hilay angkabi-ay bengat, hilan Nowi boy hilatew a aayop a anti ihtew ha bangka.

After the rains stopped, the boat floated on the water for five months, and then one day the boat rested on the top of a mountain. But the world was still covered with water. After three more months, the tops of the mountains were visible.Ha loob nin anem a boan, hiyay babe lota, natagpenan nin lanom. Haanin, hiyay Apo Dioh, namaangin yan makhaw ta omon ya omababe ye lanom. Ha naabot yay ikapiton boan, hiyay bangka a anhakyan nan Nowi, nitanghad ya ha mabakil a pinanangalanan Mapantay nan Ararat.

After forty more days, Noah sent out a bird called a raven to see if the water had dried up. The raven flew back and forth looking for dry land, but it could not find any.Ha nalabah ye ikamapo a boan, nakit laynay mabakil. Ket hiyay dinyag nan Nowi, pinalpad na ya ye maghay owak, noba ahe yaynan nag-odong.

Later Noah sent out a bird called a dove. But it also could not find any dry land, so it came back to Noah. A week later he sent the dove out again, and it came back with an olive branch in its beak! The water was going down, and the plants were growing again!Haanin, intobol na ya ye maghay kalapati. Hiyay kalapati, tampol yan nag-odong ta homain ya po mahagpaan boy homain ya po maaponan ta pawa po lanom ye babe lota.

Noah waited another week and sent out the dove a third time. This time, it did not come back. The water had dried up!Pagkalabah anan pitoy mangaamot, intobol na yan oman ye kalapati. Tampol yan nag-odong a ampangaget boong kayo. Pangayadi anan pitoy mangaamot, intobol na yayna man yatew a kalapati, noba hiyay kalapati, ahe yaynan nag-odong.

Two months later God said to Noah, “You and your family and all the animals may leave the boat now. Have many children and grandchildren and fill the earth.” So they obeyed and left the boat.Haanin, nakit nan Nowi a hiyay babe lota, namal-an ana. Hinabi nin Apo Dioh kanan Nowi, a wana, “Omalih kawoyna ha loob bangka.”

After he got off the boat, Noah built an altar and sacrificed some of each kind of animal which could be used for a sacrifice. God was happy with the sacrifice and blessed Noah and his family.Ket hilan Nowi, lomombah hilayna ha bangka palakew ha lota. Hiyay ona lan dinyag, nagpahalamt hila kanan Apo Dioh ha pangiligtah na kanla. Namatey hilan maghay topa ket in-olam la ya bilang pamahalamat la kanan Apo Dioh ta in-ligtah na hila.

God said, “I will never again curse the ground because of humans or destroy the world with a flood, even though humans are sinful from their youth.”Haanin, hinabi nin Apo Dioh kanla, a wana, “Hiyay babe lota, ahe koynan omanen lanaben.

God then made the first rainbow as a sign of His promise. Every time the rainbow appeared in the sky, God would remember what He promised and so would His people.Manyag akon bowakaw a pagkakitan kanlan tatao a hiyay babe lota, ahe koynan omanen lanaben.”**Tema: Kalok-an nin tatao****Tetepet:**1) Hinyay maadal tawo tongkol kanan Satanas ha dinyag nin bikat?2) Hinya hilay pang-oyoy nin Satanas kantawo haanin?3) Way-omen tawo labanan ye pang-oyoy nin Satanas kantawo?**Tongkol kanan Apo Jesus:**Hika boy hiyay babae ket mapayaway kawo. Hiyay lahi mo, boy lahi na,lanang hilan mapaylaban. Hiyay lahi na (Jesus) ye mamitpit ha ō mo,ket hika ye manoka ha bitih na. (Genesis 3:15)

Ha kaboyotan nin panaon a pamigantah nin lanab, linomabong ana man ye tataō ihti ha babe lota boy mamagha po ye kalahin habi la. Noba ahe hila ampanombong ha bilin nan Apo Dioh a magtayak hilan makew ha kaganaan a lologal ha babe lota.

Malambong hila. Kaya-bay napaymamaghaan lay mangipaideng nin matagay a baag. Ta yatin matagay a baag, labay la yan miabot ha langit. Ha nakit nan Apo Dioh yati, tanda na a kapahalombangan kana. Kaya-bay anhigodowen na a malalabong po lano ye madyag lan mangaloke.

Ket hiyay dinapat nan Apo Dioh, pinahabi na hilan malabong a kalahin hahabi ta omen hilayna ahe mapaykataloh. Ket mapayngingihiyay hilayna. Ket oli ha ahe la pamaykataloh, ket napaytayak-tayak hilaynan nakew ha kanayon a lologal.

Haanin, ha pangayadi nin gatoh-gatoh a taon, main maghay laki a nagngalan nin Abram. Ket hiyay ngalan nin ahawa na, Sarai. Ket hiyay Abram, kinatongtong na yan Apo Dioh, a wana, “Alihan moy logal mo boy hilay papaltido mo, ta makew kawon miahawa ha logal a ipakit ko kammo.’’
Ket hiyay Abram boy ahawa na, nagtige hilaynan palakew ha logal a ipakit nan Apo Dioh kanla. Ha niabot hila ihtew, nagpangako yay Apo Dioh kana, a wana,
“Hilatin kaganaan a lologal a angkakit mo, ibyay ko kammo a tawiden lan lalahi mo."

One day, Abram met Melchizedek, the priest of God Most High. Melchizedek blessed Abram and said, “May God Most High who owns heaven and earth bless Abram.” Then Abram gave Melchizedek a tenth of all he owned.**Tema: Kaligtahan nin Apo Dioh****Tetepet:**1) Hinyay katanam nan Apo Dioh no makit nay kalok-an tawo?2) Hinyay makit tawo ha ihtolya yati tongkol ha ogali nan Apo Dioh?3) Hinyay hohton diyagen tawo no iligtah na kitawon Apo Dioh?**Tongkol kanan Apo Jesus:**"Omon a nalyadi ha panaon nan Noe, wanabay met lano ye malyadi hapanlomateng nin Anak nin Tao (Jesus). Ta kananyatew a panaon, bayolinomateng ye lanab ha babe lota, hilay tatao, ampangan, ampinom boyampipay-aahawa anggaynan naabot ye mangaamot a hinomlep hilaynanNowi ha mayadet a bangka. Hilatew a tatao, homain ka-edep-edep hamalyadi anggan linomateng ye lanab ket nangaalimeh hila. Wanabaymet ateed lanoy malyadi ha panlomateng ko a ibat ha langit a in-Anaknin Tao." (Mateo 24:37-39)

Ket inihip nan Abram, a wana, “Ampamteg ako a topaden nan Apo Dioh ye kaganaan a impangako na kangko.” Kaya-bay hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanan Abram, “Oli ha pamteg mo kangko, an-ibilang katan matoynong”, wana. . Noba hiyay maidap, homain hila po a anak. Ket no wanabay, way-omon awod a matopad ye pangako nan Apo Dioh a hiyay Abram ye pangibatan nin mayadet a nahyon?

Ket hilay lalahi mo, palabongen ko hila boy mag-ilyadi hilan mayadet a nahyon. Ket hikoyna haanin ye Apo Dioh yo. Boy inged kata ta omon la matandaan nin kalabongan a tatao ye ngalan mo. Boy inged ko hila met ye manginged kamo, noba hilay manoboy kammo, toboyan ko hila met. Ket makaoli ha lalahi mo a inged ko, inged ko hila met ye kaganaan a nanahyon.’’

chapters.title: 4. Hiyay Pangako nan Apo Dioh kanan Abraham

frames.text: Paibat ha nagpangako yay Apo Dioh, ket lowampo anay taon a nalabah, noba homain hila po ateed anak. Haanin, hiyay Abram, nange na yayna man a naghabi yay Apo Dioh, a wana, “Magkaanak kan maghay lāki, ket lomabong hila lano ye lalahi mo a omen ha kalabongan nin bibitoen ha langit.” Ket ha nange nayna man Abram ye pangako nan Apo Dioh, ket pinamtegan nayna man.

Ha maghay mangaamot, hiyay Sarai, hinabi na kanan Abram a ahawa na, a wana, “Way-omen yati? Matowa akoyna noba homain kita po pianakan. Kadihko, ahe na impaloboh nin Apo Dioh a manganak ako. Homain bali man, ta anti ya man ye Hagar a ipoh ko. Takehen mo ya ta omon ya manganak. Ket hiyay anak na, ibilang ko yan hadili kon anak.’’

“Ta, hiyay Sarah a ahawa mo, manganak yan lāki a pangalanan mon Isaac. Ket hiyay anak mo kanan ahawa mon kaptegan ye pakapitopadan nin pangako ko kammo. Kaya-bay paibat haanin, pangalanan katan Abraham, a hiyay labay nan habiyen, ‘pang-ibatan nin malabong a lalahi nin nanahyon.’ ’”, wanan Apo Dioh.

Haanin, hiyay Sarah, main yaynan idad a hiyammapo a taon. Ket hiyay Abraham, magatoh ana met ye taon na ha i-anak na yan Sarah, ye lāki a impangako nan Apo Dioh. Ket pinangalanan la yan Isaac. Ta wanabay ye imbilin nan Apo Dioh kanla.

Ha mak-haw yaynay Isaac, hinobok nan Apo Dioh ye pāmteg nan Abraham. Hinabi nan Apo Dioh kana, a wana, “Kowen mo yay Isaac a bogtong a anak mo kanan Sarah. Ta ilakew mo ya ha mapantay nin Moriah. Ta hiyabay ye ihagpa mon olamen a bilang idigalo mo kangko.’’ Ket tinopad nayna man Abraham ye imbilin nan Apo Dioh kana.

Ket haanin, binalol na yay anak na, ta inhagpa na ya ha pangolaman ta ihtew na ya pateyen. Noba ha pateyen na yayna dayi ye anak na, impangha nin pānobolen nan Apo Dioh, a wana, “Adey! Adi mo ya ampateyen ye anak mo! Ta nakit naynan Apo Dioh ye pamteg mo, ta main kan limo kana.Ta ahe mo ya kinawaen a idigalo kana ye anak mo!’’

Ha pamigantah nan impangha nin pānobolen nan Apo Dioh, nakit na yan Abraham ye maghay topa a nakahaet ye hongay na ha hahanga nin kayo. Ket hiyay ihip nan Abraham, wanae,, “Ah! Yatiyna ye kahagiliyan nan Isaac a pateyen kon idigalo ko dayi kanan Apo Dioh,” wana. Ket hiyay topan nakahaet ye inhagpa nan inolam a indigalo na kanan Apo Dioh.

Ha pangayadi, hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanan Abraham a, “Oli ta nakit kon naikpeh mo yan idigalo kangko ye anak mo, ket ipangako ko kammo a inged kata. Palabongen ko hilay lalahi mo a omon ha kalabongan nin bibitoen ha langit. Ket makaoli ha kangedan nin lalahi mo, inged ko hila met ye kaganaan a papamilya  ihti ha babe lota, oli ta tinopad mo’y bibilin ko kammo.”

Ha matowa yaynay Abraham boy bayon tao yayna met ye Isaac, hiyay Abraham, nangitobol yan ipoh na a makew ha logal lan totowa nan Abraham. Ta makew yan mamili nin babalatang kanlan papaltido na, a malyadin ahawaen nan Isaac a anak nan Abraham kanan Sarah.

Pangayadi nin kaboyotan a pangomodang nin ipoh, main yan nakit a libon. Ket nagpaked ya ihtew. Ha anlolomiteh ana, anlomateng hilaynay bābayin makew manayeb. Nakigwang yay ipoh kanan Apo Dioh, a wana, “Apo Dioh, haglapan mo ko. Anti ko ihti ha haley nin libon a panayeban lan babalatang. Ket hiyay labay ko, no hinya dayi mamiyay kangkon inomen ko boy mamainom kanlan kakamelyo ko, yabaytew yayna ye pagkakitan a labay mon ibiyay kangko a pag-ahawa nan Isaac.” Ha ampakigwang ya po, main anan linomateng ihtewbay a matampa a babayi. Rebekah ye ngalan na. Apo na yan Nahor a katongno nan Abraham. Ket hiyay Rebekah, pinainom na yay ipoh boy pinainom na hila met ye kakamelyo nan ipoh.

Ha pamigantah nin pamainom nan Rebekah, ket noli ya. Ket nakilakew ya met ye ipoh. Ha niabot hila ha baey, hiyay ipoh, in-awok na kanlan pamilya nan Rebekah, a wana kanla, “No malyadi dayi, makilakew yay Rebekah kangko, ta ahawaen na yan Isaac a anak nan amo ko.” Ket hiyay indo nan Rebekah, tinepet na ya met ye Rebekah, a wana, “Rebekah, makilakew ka nayi kana o ahe?” “ Makilakew ako kana,” wanan Rebekah. Ha lomateng hila ha baey nan Abraham, ket nakit na yan Isaac ye balatang a nagngalan Rebekah. Ket tinanggap na ya met nin Isaac a pag-ahawa na.

Haanin, ha kaboyotan nin panaon, natey yay Abraham. Ket hiyay kangedan a impangako nan Apo Dioh kanan Abraham, ket tanda naynan alan nin Isaac a maipalakew kana. Noba hiyay Isaac boy Rebekah, homain hila po anak. Inihip nan Isaac, a wana, “Hiyay maidap, homain kayi po pianakan. Way-ihtew ye kangedan ko? Way-omon akon mag-ilyadin bapa nin malabong a nanahyon?”
Ket hiyay Isaac, nakigwang ya kanan Apo Dioh, a wana, “Apo, no kalabayan mo, magkaanak kayi.” Ket tinopad nan Apo Dioh ye pamakigwang nan Isaac, ta naboktot yay Rebekah.
Ha maboktot ya po ye Rebekah nin kambal, inhabi naynan Apo Dioh kanan Rebekah, a wana, “Hiyay makaagat a anak mon kambal, maghilbi ya kanan ali na.” Ket nanganak yan kambal a lālaki.
Ha naianak hilayna, hiyay makaagat, pinangalanan la yan Esau. Ket  matibya ya boy malabok ye lalaman na. Hiyay makaydeng, pinangalanan la yan Jacob.

Haanin, linomake hilaynay kambal. Hiyay Isaac, ampakaado-adoen na yay makaagat. Ket hiyay Rebekah met, ampakaado-adoen na yay makaydeng. Hiyay Esau, māngakal ya. Noba hiyay Jacob, māngomponi ya ha baey.

Ha matowa yaynay Isaac, labay nan ipataya kanan makaagat ye kangedan a inibyay nan Apo Dioh kana. Noba ha natandaan nan Rebekah a hiyay makaagat ye pangipatayaan nan Isaac nin kangedan na, dinandali na yan inopitan ye makaydeng.
Ket tinalingo la yay Isaac. Ta labay nan Rebekah bengat a hiyay makaydeng ye pangipatayaan nin kangedan nan Isaac.
Ha natandaan nan Esau a tinalingo la yan mitaindo, napoot yan tobat. Ket hiyay inihip nan Esau, “No matey yaynay bapa tawo, pateyen ko yay ali ko.”

Noba ha natandaan nan Rebekah boy Isaac ye ihip nan makaagat, ket hinabi nan Rebekah kanan makaydeng, “Anak ko, manandali kaynan makew kanlan papaltido ko. Ta labay na kan pateyen nin kaka mo”, wanan Rebekah.
Ha anti yaynay Jacob ihtew ha logal nin papaltido nan indo na, nakaalalak yan labinloway lālaki boy maghay babayi. Ket binomatnang yan tobat ihtew.
Ha main yaynan lowampo a taon ihtew ha logal lan papaltido nan Rebekah, noli hilayna ha Canaan a logal a impangako nan Apo Dioh, kalamo na hilay papamilya na, iipoh boy aayop na.

Ha anti hila ha dān, angkalimo ya. Ta naihipan na ye hinabi nan kaka na a patyen na ya. Ket hiyay dinapat na, nangipaona yan malabong a a kambing boy malabong a topa. Lowanggatoh boy lowampo ye bilang nin kambing. Wanabay met ye bilang nin topa. Ta yati ye imolta na kanan kaka na.

Noba, hiyay kaka na, alan na yaynan pinatawad ye ali na. Ket ha niabot hila, napaytipontipon hilan mahayaghag. Ket hiyay Jacob, main yaynan katanaan. Ta kinomonin yayna ha logal a impangako nan Apo Dioh kanla. Ket ha natey yay Isaak a bapa la, hiyay papangako nan Apo Dioh kanan Isaak, naipalakew met kanan Jacob.
Ha matowa yaynay Jacob, main maghay mangaamot a intobol na yay maghay anak na a pinakaado-ado na a nagngalan Jose. Hinabi na kana, “Anak ko, lakwen mo hilan bilewen ye kakatongno mon ampagpahtol.”

Hilay kakatongno na, tanda la a hiyay Jose ye ampakaado-adoen nan bapa la boy tanda la met ye taynep nan Jose a hiyabay ye mamoon kanla. Kaya-bay main hilan hakit nakem kanan Jose. Ket haanin, ha linomateng yay Jose kanlan kakatongno na, kingwa la ya boy inkolbot la yayna. Noba main anhomapid a māgpanapolan, ket kingwa la ya ha lobot. Ta inlako la ya kanlan māgpanapolan. Ket kinaget la yayna palakew ha Egipto.

Haanin, hilay kakatongno na, ha noli hila ha baey la, impakit la ye bado nan Jose kanan bapa la, a wanla, “Tatang, nakit mi ye bado nan Jose ha dān.” Ket hiyay Jacob, hinabi na, “Kadihko main matobag a ayop a namatey kanna.” Ket nilomele yaynan tobat.
Haanin, hilay māgpanapolan, ha niabot hila ha Egipto, inlako la yayna man ye Jose ha maghay mabatnang, a nagngalan Potiphar. Ha anti yaynay Jose ihtew ha Egipto, mapatayaan ya ha amo na.

Noba hiyay ahawa nan amo na, labay na yan makilaki kanan Jose. Haanin, hiyay Jose, ahe na labay ye magkahalanan kanan Apo Dioh. Ket hiyay ahawa nan Potiphar, binadaan na yay Jose a homain kaptegan. Kaya-bay naipidiho ya. Noba agya anti ya ha pidihowan, ket mapatayaan yan teed, ta an-inged na yan Apo Dioh.
Kananyatew a panaon, hiyay Poon Paraon a ampanakop ha Egipto, nanaynep ya. Ket nagolowan ya ta homain mangipatanda kana no hinyay labay nan habiyen nin tataynep na.

Ket hiyay Jose, tanda nay labay habiyen nin tataynep. Ta an-ipatanda nan Apo Dioh kana. Ket hiyay Poon Paraon, nabalitaan na a hiyay Jose, tanda nan ipatong ye labay habiyen nin tātaynep. Kaya-bay impakwa na yay Jose ha pidihowan, ta labay nan Poon Paraon a ipatanda nan Jose ye labay habiyen nin taynep na. Ket ha anti yaynay Jose ha adapan na, hinabi na kanan Jose, “Jose, ipatanda mo dayi kangko ye labay habiyen nin taynep ko.” Ket hinabi nan Jose kana, “Anggalangen a Poon Paraon, impatanda nan Apo Dioh kangko ye labay habiyen nin taynep mo. Ket wanae ye labay habiyen. Ha loob nin pitoy taon, manged ye popol ihti ha Egipto, noba main met domondon a loob nin piton taon a homain anan mapopol.”
Hiyay Poon Paraon, ha nange nay labay habiyen nin taynep, naaliket ya kanan Jose. Kaya-bay dinyag na yan ikalwan pinakamatagay a māmaala ihtew ha nahyon Egipto.

Hiyay kalabongan nin popol ha Egipto ha loob nin pitoy taon, ket hiyay Jose ye ampanalima nin natipon boy hiya met ateed ye ampamaala kanlan ampanipon nin kanayon a popol ihtew ta omon la maihinop ye kanayon a popol ha Egipto. Ket ha naabot anay domondon a loob nin pitoy taon, nag-idap hilaynay tatao.

Ta angkabitlan hilaynan tobat. Aliwan bengat ha Egipto ye ampakatanam nin tobat a bitil. Ta agya met ha Canaan a logal a impangako nan Apo Dioh a angkonaan lan Jacob, angkabitlan hila met ateed. Ket hiyay dinapat nan Jose, inlako na kanlan ampag-idap ha Egipto ye natipon ta omon hilan main makan.

Ket ha nabalitaan lan Jacob a anti ha Canaan, a malabong ye makan ihtew ha Egipto, intobol na hilay aanak na a manaliw kanan Jose. Kaya-bay nakew hilay kakatongno nan Jose ha nahyon Egipto. Ha niabot hilayna ihtew, ahe la ya tanda a hiyay Jose manayti ye ampamaala ha nahyon Egipto. Noba, hiyay Jose, tanda na a hilabay ye kakatongno na a nangilako kana.

Hiyay Jose, hinobok na hilay kakatongno na, no peteg a naoman anay ogali la. Ha natandaan na a nagbayo hilayna, nagpatanda yay Jose kanla. Ket hinagyat na hilayna a komonin ha Ehipto. Ta haglapan na hila.

Ha noli hilaynay kakatongno na, imbalita la kanlan bapa la, a wanla, “Tatang, angkabi-ay ya po manayti ye Jose. Anhagyaten na kitawon komonin ihtew ha Egipto ta omon na kitawo kano mahaglapan,” wanla. Ha natandaan nan Jacob a angkabi-ay ya po ye Jose, naaliket yan tobat.
Agya matowa yaynay Jacob, oli ha aliket na, nakew ya ha Egipto, kalamo na hilay pamilya na. Ket kinomonin hilayna ihtew. Noba bayo yan natey ye Jacob, in-inged na hila po ye kaganaan a aanak na.

Haanin, hiyay papangako nan Apo Dioh kanan Abraham, naipalakew kanan Isaac. Ket ha natey yay Isaac, naipalakew met kanan Jacob. Ket ha natey yay Jacob, naipalakew met ha labinlowan aanak na boy papamilya la. Hilatin labinlowan aanak nan Jacob ye nag-ilyadin labinlowan kalahin tidibo a anhabtan Israel. Ta aanak na hilan Jacob a anhabtan met Israel.**Tema: Pagpatawad****Tetepet:**1) Taket ta pinalobohan nan Apo Dioh a mailako yay Jose kanlanmāgpanapolan?2) Hinyay malyadi tawon maadal ha dinyag nan Jacob kanan Esau?Hinyay malyadi tawon maadal ha dinyag nan Esau kanan Jacob?3) Hinyay malyadi tawon maadal ha dinyag nan Jose kanlankakatongno na?**Tongkol kanan Apo Jesus:**Haanin, naghabi yay Apo Jesus, a wana, “Bapa ko, patawaden mo hilayampanyag nin wanabay kangko. Ta ahe la tanda ye andiyagen la.”(Lucas 23:34)

chapters.title: 8. God Saves Joseph and His Family

frames.text: Ha natey yaynay Jose, hilay papaltido na, angkomonin hila po ha Ehipto. Ha kaboyotan  nin panaon, ket hilay lālahi la a anhabtan Israelita, linomabong hilayna.

Ha kaboyotan nin panaon, hilay taga Ehipto, naliwaan la yaynay Jose boy hiyay pāghilbi na kanlan taga Egipto. Haanin, main ana met nin bayon nagpoon ha Egipto. Ket naliwaan na met ye panaglap nan Jose. Ket yatin bayon poon, in-ipoh na hilay Israelita.
Hilay Ehipsio, pinilit la hilay Israelita a manyag nin mangatagay a baey boy maway a banwa.
Noba ha nakit nan Poon Paraon a haingan hilaynan anlomabong ye aanak lan Israelita, ket nanyag yan bilin, a wanae, “No lāki ye maianak nin Israelita, itapon ye ongi ha kabatwan ta omon ya matey.”

Haanin, main maghay Israelita a babayi a nanganak nin lāki. Tanda nan babayi ye bilin nan Poon Paraon a pateyen ye anak a lāki. Ket hinabi na ha hadili na a, “Itayo ko yay ongi ko legan ahe na po tanda nin Poon Paraon.”

Kaya-bay nanyag yan belyag haka na pinonahan nin lilin ta omon ahe mahlepan nin lanom. Pangayadi, ingkonin nayay ongi ha belyag ket inlakew nayayna ha gilid lanom a kataiban ha kabatwan. Hiyay katongno nan ongi a nagngalan Miriam, nakew ya met ha kabatwan, ta ambabantayan na ya no hinyay malyadi kana.

Haanin, hiyay balatang nan Poon Paraon, nakit na yay belyag ha kabatowan. Ket impakwa na ya kanan ipoh na. Ha inlateng na ya, linokatan nan balatang nan Poon ye belyag. Ket nakit na yay ongi. Hiyay dinapat na, kingwa na yay ongi. Ta pag-anak na yayna. Ket Moises ye impangalan na.

Hiyay Moises, niyomadet ya ha baey nan Poon lan Egipsio. Haanin, ha bayontao yayna, nagpahyal ya ha logal lan Israelita. Ket nakit nay maghan Israelita a ampahakitan nin maghan Egipsio. Oli ta tanda nan Moises a kapadiho na yan Israelita, ket hinaglapan na ya.
Ket ha nabaan nan Moises a homain ampakakit, ket pinatey na yay Egipsio boy in-ilbeng na ya. Noba main manayti nakakit ha dinapat na. Ket yatin dinapat nan Moises, nabalitaan nan Poon Paraon.

Ket ha natandaan nan Poon Paraon ye nalyadi, labay na yan pateyen ye Moses. Noba ha natandaan nan Moises a pateyen na yan Poon Paraon, tinomakah ya, ta makew ya ha mataang a logal. Ket ihtewbay ya kinomonin.
Hiyay Moises, ampagpahtol yan aayop ha wangwang a mataang ha Ehipto. Ket ihtew yayna met nakaahawa. Ket nakaalalak ya nin loway lālaki.

Main maghay mangaamot a kapelhan nan ampagpahtol nin kakalnilo. Ket nakakit yan maghay makandin kayo a andomlag. Noba tandah yan ahe maolam. Kaya-bay hinaleyan na ya. Ket ha mahaley yayna, nange na yan naghabi ye Apo Dioh a anti ha makandin kayon andomlag.

Ket hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanan Moses, “Moises, mag-odong ka ha Egipto. Ta hika ye gawien kon mangiligtah kanlan Israelita a inipoh lan Egipsio,” wanan Apo Dioh. Hinabi nan Apo Dioh yati, ta labay na a mag-odong hilay Israelita ihtew ha Canaan a logal a impangako nan Apo Dioh kanla. Ta yabaytew a logal ye impangako na kanlan Abraham, Isaac boy Jacob.
Noba hiyay Moses, ahe na labay ye makew ha Egipto. Ta angkalimo ya.

Ket hiyay dinapat nan Apo Dioh, intobol na yay Aaron a katongno nan Moises. Ta hiyabay ye managlap kanan Moises. Noba hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanlan Moses boy Aaron, a wana, “Adi kawo anhomoko. Magteeh kawo. Ta mabyang ye tonga nan Poon Paraon ha Egipto.”

Hiyay Moises boy Aaron, nakew hilan makitongtong kanan Poon Paraon. Hinabi la kana, a wanla, “Anggalangen a Poon Paraon, katapolan a palobohan mo hilan omalih ye Israelita. Ta yati ye kalabayan nan Apo Dioh.” Noba kinomaili yan bengat ye Poon Paraon, a wana, “Agko malabay ta ahe koya katatanda yatin Dioh yo!” Ket agna hila pinalobohan, no aliwan lalo na hilayna ingat pinaidapan.

Hiyay Poon Paraon, pihahabi na a, “Ahe ko hila palobohan a omalih!” Ket hiyay dinapat nan Apo Dioh, nangipalwah yan 10 a kalahin pamaidap a mamaidap kanlan Egipsio. Boy hinabi na a, “Labay kon ipakit a omiigit po ye kapalyadian ko dinan ha kapalyadian nan Poon Paraon boy kapalyadian nin diohdiohan na.”

Pinag-ilyadi nan daya nin Apo Dioh ye lanom ha kabatowan a anhabtan Nilo. Ha nakatanam hilan idap, nakew yayna man ye Moises kanan Poon Paraon. Awoken nayna man a ilwah na hilay Israelita. Noba, hinabi nayna man nin Poon Paraon, a wana, “Ahe ko hila palobohan a omalih!”
Hiyay dinapat nan Apo Dioh ha kakalwan kalahin pamaidap, ket nangipalwah yan malabong a pahinga.

Pangayadi, ha ikatlon kalahin pamaidap, nangipalwah yay naman nin titime. Ket ha ikaapat a kalahin pamaidap, nangipalwah yayna man nin lalangew. Balang magha kananyatin pamaidap, an-ipangako nan Poon Paraon, a wana, “No alihen nan Apo Dioh hilatin pamaidap, palobohan ko hilaynan omalih ye Israelita.”Nikaapat po anan okdo ye pangialih nan Apo Dioh nin pamaidap. Noba tepe alihen nan Apo Dioh ye pamaidap, paodong-odong ye binyangan nin tonga nan Poon Paraon. Ta pihahabi na, “Agkoyna palobohan a omalih hilay Israelita.”  Kaya-bay, hiyay Apo Dioh, pinaidapan na hilayna man oman ye Ehipsio. Haanin, hilay taga Ehipton bengat ye nadānan nin pamaidap. Noba kanlan Israelita, homain napano kanla.
Hiyay ikaliman kalahin pamaidap, pinalwah nan Apo Dioh ye hakit a mamatey nin kaganaan a aayop lan taga Ehipto.
Pagkayadi, hiyay ikaanem a kalahin pamaidap, intobol pinalwah nan Apo Dioh ye kokoyapeh a tanamen lan taga Ehipto.

Hiyay ikapito a kalahin pamaidap, namaodan yay Apo Dioh nin tabolinaw. Ket yabaytew a tabolinaw, ingkamatey lan kaganaan a Egipsio a anti ha ilwah nin baey la. Boy nakadama po nin tatanaman lan Egipsio. Noba ha logal a angkonaan lan Israelita, homain bega natey kanla boy homain natey a tatanaman la.

Agya wanabay anay nalyadi a pamaidap, hiyay Poon Paraon, ket ahe yayna man manlenge kanan Apo Dioh no aliwan, anlomalo anan tobat ye kabiyangan nin tonga na. Ta ahe na hilayna man pinalobohan omalih ye Israelita.
Ket hiyay ikawalon kalahin pamaidap, namalwah yan malabong a kokowangey. Ket hiyay ye tela a dinama nin tabolinaw, kinan met nin kokowangey.

Pangayadi, hiyay ikahiyam a kalahin pamaidap, ket pinaliteh nan Apo Dioh ye logal a angkonaan lan Egipsio ha loob nin tatlon mangaamot. Ket ahe hilayna makalwah ha babaey la. Noba, mahnag ye angkonaan lan Israelita.

Agya wanabay anay nalyadi, hiyay Poon Paraon, hinabi nayna man kanan Moises, a wana, “Ahe ko hila palobohan a omalih”, wana. Noba main po kalinghoyotan a maghan kalahin pamaidap. Agya ahe ya bega nangibabano ye Poon Paraon ha nangaonan dinapat nan Apo Dioh, ket yatin ikamapo a dapaten nan pamaidap, maalih ana ye binyangan nin tonga nan Poon Paraon.**Tema: Kaligtahan nan Apo Dioh kanlan tatao na****Tetepet:**1) Hinyay maadal tawo tongkol ha tataon pilien nan Apo Dioh a maghilbikana?2) Hinyay angkatanam nan Apo Dioh tongkol kanlan tataon angkaidapan?3) Hinyay maadal tawo tongkol ha kapalyadiyan nan Apo Dioh haihtolya a yati?**Tongkol kanan Apo Jesus:**Hiyay Moises met ye naghabi kanlan kapadiho nan Israelita, a wana,‘Lomateng lanoy panaon a hiyay Apo Dioh, mamili yan magha (Jesus) halahi' tawo a diyagen nan propitan māngihabin Habi nin Dioh a omonkangko,’ wanan Moises. (Diyag 7:37)

Hiyay Moises boy Aaron, binabalaan la yay Poon Paraon, a wanla kana, “Hinabi nan Apo Dioh a no adi mo hila po ateed palobohan a omalih ye Israelita, matey hilan kaganaan a poponganay a lālakin aanak yon Egipsio boy hilay poponganay nin aayop yo.” Agya ha wanabay man, ahe ya po teed nanlenge ye Poon Paraon, ha bilin nan Apo Dioh. Kaya-bay, intobol nan Apo Dioh ye pānobolen na a mamatey nin kaganaan a ponganay a lālakin anak lan Egipsio boy mamatey nin kaganaan a ponganay nin aayop la.
Imbilin nan Apo Dioh kanla, a wana, “Mamatey kawon kalnilo o kambing a nagtaon nin magha.

Hiyay daya na, iponah yo ha gilid ilwangan nin babaey yo. No hombongen yo yati, ket maliklikan yoy kamateyan nin poponganay yo. Pangayadi, iyawen yo ya boy ipakawoto, ta pangakan yon tinapay yo a homain pampalbag. Pagkayadi, mag-aligwat kawo ta omen omalih kawoyna ha Egipto.”
Hilay Israelita, tinopad lay bilin nan Apo Dioh. Kananyatin madeglem, hiyay pānobolen nan Apo Dioh, nakew ya ha kaganaan a lologal a anhakopen nin Ehipto.

Ha anlomateng yay pānobolen nan Apo Dioh ha baey a main daya ha ilowangan, anlabhan na. Ket ha wanabay, nakaligtah ye kaganaan a poponganay lan Israelita makaoli ha daya nin kalnilo, a imponahponah la.
Noba pinatey nay kaganaan a ponganay a lāki lan Ehipsio. Wanabay met ha poponganay nin aayop la.
Hilay Ehipsio, tinomangih hila oli ha nalyadi ha poponganay la.

Ha natandaan nan Poon Paraon a natey hilaynay kaganaan a poponganay a lālakin aanak lan Ehipsio boy aayop la, ket impahagyat na yay Moises boy Aaron. Hinabi na kanla, a wana, “Hikawon Israelita, omalih kawoyna ihti! Kageten yo hilan kaganaan ye aayop yo.”

Ha pabekah, inomalih hilaynay Israelita ha Ehipto. Ket angkaaliket hilan tobat, ta aliwa hilaynan ipoh. Boy angkaaliket hilaynan makalakew ha logal a impangako nan Apo Dioh kanla. Hilay Egipsio, namyay hilan digalo a ginto boy pilak kanlan Israelita. Main met Israelita a nakilakew kanlan Israelita.
No mangaamot ye pangomodang la, hiyay Apo Dioh, anti ya ha owep, a ampona ta omon la matandaan ye dānan la. Ket no madeglem, hiyay Apo Dioh, mahnag yan ba’mon apoy a angkaona kanla.
Ket ahe naboyot, hiyay Poon Paraon boy hilay tatao na, an-ihipen la no way-omen la hilayna man mapagipoh ye Israelita.
Haanin, hiyay Poon Paraon, hinagyat na hilay hohondaloh na, ta kamaten la hilay Israelita. Ket ha natamolaw lan Israelita ye hohondaloh a ampangamat kanla, nalimo hilan tobat.
Hiyay Apo Dioh, hinabi na kanan Moises, a wana, “Makew kawoynan ha Matibya a Dagat. Ta ipakit ko ye kapalyadiyan ko.”
Ket hiyay apoy a angkonaan nan Apo Dioh ha madeglem, nakew ya ha hoyotan lan Israelita. Kaya-bay hilay Ehipsio a ampangamat kanla, ahe la hilayna makitan, oli ha makogpa a owep a anti ha pietan la.
Ket hiyay Moses, intawo na yan bengat ye Matibya a Dagat. Ket hiyay Apo Dioh, namaangin yan mak-haw. Ket nabtak yay lanom nin dagat. Ket naanggaan yay lota a mamala, angga ha malyadi laynan dānan.
Ket hiyay lanom, nailingling ya ha maitaligmang a gilid nin dān. Ket hilay Israelita, kinomodang hila ha namalan a lota.
Haanin, tinomagay yay owep. Ket nakit lan Ehipsio, a angkomodang hilaynay Israelita ha pietan nin lanom a nailingling.
Ket hilay Ehipsio, hinombong la hila ha andānan lan Israelita. Noba hiyay lota a namala, pinapita’ na yan Apo Dioh. Ket ihtew hilayna nangaitatahek.

Ha nakalipay hilaynay Israelita, hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanan Moses, a wana, “Tawoen mon oman ye dagat.” Ket ha tinawo nan oman nin Moises ye dagat, niaep yay lanom. Hilay kaganaan lan Egipsio a nangaitatahek ihtew ha pietan nin lanom, ket natey hilan alimeh.
Ha nakit lan Israelita ye nalyadi kanlan Ehipsio, namteg hilayna kanan Apo Dioh a pinatayaan na yay Moses bilang propita na.

Naaliket hilan tobat ye Israelita, oli ha pangiligtah nan Apo Dioh kanla ha pagkaipoh la kanan Poon Paraon. Ket haanin, nagkanta hilaynan panggalang kanan Apo Dioh boy pamahalamat kana, ta inligtah na hila.

Imbilin nan Apo Dioh kanlan Israelita, a wana, “Balang taon, hayaghagan yoy pangiligtah ko kanyo ha Egipto boy mangihagpa kawon digalon homain pakaomihan bilang pangihipan nin pangiligtah ko kanyo paibat hatew ha anti kawo po ha Egipto.”
Ha nakadān hilaynay Israelita ha Matibya a Dagat, in-ogot na hila nin Apo Dioh ha mapantay a anhabtan Sinai. Ket inhadya lay totolda la ha aphayan nin mapantay.
Haanin, hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanan Moses boy kanlan Israelita, “No hombongen yoy hahabi ko boy pabliyen yoy pamakikahondo ko kanyo, ket hikawoynan bengat ye pagtao kon maghilbi kangko.”

Ha pangayadi nin ikatlon mangaamot, hilay Israelita, ampaholawen la yay Apo Dioh a domoong ha Mapantay nin Sinai kalamban nay kilat, kodol, makogpan anoh boy mak-haw a tamboyok. Ket namigpig hilay tatao, ta nalimwan hila. Hiyay Moises bengat ye napalobohan a manik ihtew ha mapantay.

Ket hiyay Apo Dioh, impatanda na kanan Moises a main yan kahondoan kanlan Israelita. Ket hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanan Moses, a, “Hiko ye Dioh a Apo yo a nangialih kanyo ha hatew ha pagkaipoh yo ha Egipto. Adi kawo ampanggalang ha aliwan peteg a dioh”.

“Hiko ye Dioh a Apo yo a nangialih kanyo ha hatew ha pagkaipoh yo ha Egipto. Adi kawo ampanggalang ha aliwan peteg a dioh”.“Adi kawo ampanyag nin kalintatao a galangen yo. Ta hiko ye Dioh a maimon. “Bihaen yoy panggawi nin ngalan ko.”“Adi yo anliwaan ye mangaamot nin pagpainawa, ta ibilang yo yan nadiohan. Ha loob nin anem a mangaamot, diyagen yon kaganaan a labay yon obdaen. Ta hiyay ikapiton mangaamot, yabayin yay mangaamot a panggalang yo kangko.

“Igalang yoy bapa boy indo yo ta omon ya komadang ye bi-ay yo.“Adi kawo ampamatey nin tao.“Adi kawo ampamabayi o ampakilalāki.“Adi kawo ampanakaw.“Adi kawo ampagbongkok.“Adi yo angkaibegan ye ahawa nin kapadiho yo, boy  adi yo angkaibegan ye baey na, o agya hinyaman a kabandiyan na.”

Haanin, yatin bibilin, inholat nan Apo Dioh ha loway madampilay a dapah, ta in-ibyay na kanan Moses. Malabong po ye bibilin a in-ibyay na kanla. Ket hinabi na po, a wana, “No hombongen yola yatin bibilin ko, inged katawo boy kalingayen katawo.”
Impatanda na po nin Apo Dioh kanla no way omon lan diyagen ye labay nan Apo Dioh a tolda.
Yatin tolda ye lakwen lan kaganaan a pangihagpaan nin digalo kanan Apo Dioh ta omon hila mapatawad ye tataon nagkahalanan. Yatin tolda ye anhabtan “Tabernakolo”.

Hilay Israelita, hinabi la, a wanla, “Apo, hombongen mi ye bibilin mo. Ta hikabay bengat ye Apo mi a homain kanayon.” Ket ha wanabay, hilaynay Israelita ye tatao na. Noba ha ahe maboyot, ket nagkahalanan hilan mabyat a tobat kanan Apo Dioh.

Oli ha kaboyotan nan Moses ihtew ha matondol, hilay Israelita, ahe hila nakapagteeh a ampangagad kana. Ket hilay tingga la a giginto, in-ibyay layna kanan Aaron a katongno nan Moises. Ta inawok la kana, a wanla, “Idiyagan yo kayi nin dioh a galangen mi.”

Kaya-bay, kingwa na met nin Aaron ye tingga la a giginto.  Ket dinyag na yan ba’mon oybon baka. Ta hiyabay ana ye pagdioh la. Haanin, inkana laynay manggalang boy mangihagpa ha andiohen la. Ket legan anti yapo ye Moses ha matondol, hiyay Apo Dioh, napoot yan tobat,  ta nakitnay andiyagen la. Ket labay na hilan apo-en. Noba hiyay Moises, impakiiingalo na hila, a wana, “Apo, adi mo hila dayi an-apoen.” Ket pinteg na met Apo Dioh. Kaya-bay ahe na hila inapo.

Ha dinomoong yaynay Moses paibat ha matondol, nakit na yay ba’mon oybon baka a dinyag lan andiohen la. Ket oli ha tobat a poot na, imbegba na hilay loway madampilay a dapah a nakaiholatan nin mapo a bibilin nan Apo Dioh.
Haanin, kingwa nan Moses ye andiohen la, ket tinapok-tapok na haka na inhale ha lanom, ta impainom na kanlan kaganaan. Ket hiyay Apo Dioh, nangipaatel yan hakit kanla. Ket malabong ye natey kanla.
Haanin, hiyay Apo Dioh, pinaalih na hilay Israelita ha Matondol nin Sinai. Ket inogot na hila palakew ha logal a impangako na kanla.

chapters.title: 13. Hiyay Kahondoan nan Apo Dioh kanlan Israelita

frames.text: After the Israelites received God’s Covenant at Mount Sinai, God began leading them toward the Promised Land, which was also called Canaan. The cloud pillar showed them the way.Hilay Israelita, ha natanggap lay bibilin nan Apo Dioh ihtew ha Mapantay nin Sinai, ket intobol na hilaynan makew ha logal a impangako na kanla. Hiyay Apo Dioh, a anti ha owep, ket maona ya kanla.BT - The Israelites, when they received the commands of God there on the Mountain of Sinai, he sent them to go to the place which he promised them. God, he was present in the cloud, and he will-go-ahead of them.

God had promised Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob that He would give the Promised Land to their descendants, but now there were many tribes of people living there. They were called Canaanites. The Canaanites did not believe in God. They worshiped false gods and did many evil things.Ha hatew, impangako nan Apo Dioh a byan na hilan lologal ye lalahi nan Abraham, Isaac boy Jacob. Noba ahe hila po malyadin homlep, ta main hilan latngen a malabong a tidibo ha Canaan a logal a impangako nan Apo Dioh kanla. Hilatin tribo a anti ha Canaan, ket anhabtan Cananeo. Hilay Cananeo, ahe hila ampamteg kanan Apo Dioh. Ta hiyay ampamtegan la, dioh-diohan a anggalangen la.BT - In time-past, God promised that he will-give the descendents of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob a place. But they still did not enter, for they still will-arrive-upon many clans/groups in Canaan which is the place Apo God promised to-them. These tribes which were present in Canaan, they are called Cananeo. The Cananeo (PL), they are- not -believing in God. For what they are-believing-in, false-gods which they are-worshipping/honoring.

God told the Israelites, “You must get rid of all the Canaanites in the Promised Land. Do not make peace with them and do not marry them. You must completely destroy all of their idols. If you do not do these things, you will worship their idols instead of Me.”Hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanlan Israelita, <<Labanan yo hilay kaganaan a Cananeo. Adi kaw ampakikakahondo kalla boy adi kaw met ampangahawa kalla. Boy katapolan a damaen yon kaganaan a diohdiohen la. No ahe yo hombongen yain a bilin ko kanyo, ket mipaloy kawo met a manggalang ha diohdiohan la. Dat no wanabay ket, aliwaynan hiko ye anggalangen yo.>>BT - God spoke to the Israelites, <<(You-PL) fight-against all the Cananeo(PL). Don't you(PL) make-agreements with-them and don't you(PL) also marry-with them. And you(PL) must destroy all their false-gods/idols. If you(PL) are- not -following/obeying this command of mine to-you(PL), you(PL) will-be-influenced also to honor/worship their false-gods. And if like-that, not I is what you(PL) are-worshipping/honoring.>>

When the Israelites reached the edge of Canaan, Moses chose twelve men, one from each tribe of Israel. He gave the men instructions to go and spy on the land to see what it was like. They were also to spy on the Canaanites to see if they were strong or weak.Haanin, hiyay dinapat nan Moises kanlan labinlowan lahi nan Israel, namili yan titimaghan lāki. Ket hinabi na kanla, a wana, “Makew kawo ha logal a Canaan, noba adi kawo ampakit kalla. Ta bilewen yoy logal no manged o ahe. Boy bilewen yo po hilay tatao no makapey ye panlomaban la o no mangakhaw.”BT - Now, what Moises did to the twelve twelve descendents/bloodline of Israel, he chose one-each male. And he spoke to-them, he-said, <<(You-PL) go to the place of Canaan, but don't you(PL) show [yourself] to-them. For you(PL) will-look-at the place if good or not. And (you-PL) look-at still the people if weak is their opposing or strong.>>

The men spied on Canaan for forty days, then they came back. Ten of the spies gave a bad report, saying, “The land is very good, and the crops are great! But the cities are very strong, and the people are giants! If we attack them, we will surely die!”Ket nakew hilan hinomlep ha Canaan a ahe napakit. Nangamaey hila ihtew nin apatapo a mangaamot ta mangimaton hila kanlan Cananeo. Ha nag-odong hilaynay labinlowan intobol na, hilay mapo kanla, imbalita la, a wanla, “Ihtewbay ha Canaan, ket malabong ye makan boy manged yay lota. Noba ahe kitawo malyadi a lomaban kanlan Cananeo, ta mangayadet hila boy maghen ye babanwa la. Ket hikitawo, ba-mo kitawon bengat kowangey a mangakandi kalla. Ta hilay tataon angkomonin ihtew, ket mangak-haw hila boy mangayadet ye lalaman la. No dawohongen tawo hila, ket mahambot kitawon homain hapo.”BT - And they went to enter Canaan with not causing-to-be-seen. They stayed there forty days for they will-obeserve those Cananao. When the twelve ones he sent returned, ten of them, they newsed, they-said, <<There in Canaan, many are what will-be-eaten and good is the land. But we(incl) can not fight those Cananeo, for they are big and firm are their towns. And we(incl), we(incl) are just like locusts in size to them. For the people living there, they are strong and large are their bodies. If we(incl) attack them, we(incl) will- surely -lose.>>

Immediately Caleb and Joshua, the other two spies, said, “It is true that the people of Canaan are tall and strong, but we can certainly defeat them! God will fight for us!”Noba hiyay Caleb boy Josue a lowa kanlan labinlowan intobol ha Canaan, tampol lan hinabi, a wanla, “Peteg a hilay tatao ihtew, ket mangak-haw boy mangayadet hila. Noba adi kitawo angkalimon lomaban kanla! Hamboten tawo hila a homain hapo. Ta lamo tawo yay Apo Dioh.”BT - But Caleb and Josue who are two of the twelve sent to Canaan, quickly they spoke, they-said, <<True that the people there, they are strong and big. But don't let us(incl) be-afraid to fight them! We(incl) will-defeat them surely. For God is with us(incl).>>

But the people were mad at Moses and Aaron and said, “Oh, why did you bring us to this horrible place? We should have stayed in Egypt rather than be killed in battle and our wives and children made slaves.” The people wanted to kill them and choose a new leader to bring them back to Egypt.Noba hilan kaganaan a Israelita, angkalimo hila. Kaya-bay nagdiklamo hila, a wanla, “Mamanged po dayin natey kitawoyna ihtew ha Egipto o kaya ihti ha wangwang dinan matey kitawon bengat ha labanan! Ket hilay kalaban tawo, dyagen la hilan iipoh ye aahawa tawo boy hilay aanak tawo.” Noba hiyay Moses, Aaron, Josue boy Caleb, nakiiingalo hila kanlan Israelita, a wanla, <<Adi yo ankontadaen ye Apo Dioh.>> Noba hilay Israelita, hinabi la, a wanla, <<Ahe mi labay a hikawo ye mangona kammi. Mamanged a mag-odong kayiyna ingat ha Egipto!>>BT - But all Israelites, they are-being-afraid. Therefore they complained, they-said, <<Better still (desire particle) we(incl) died there in Egipto o even here in the desert than we(incl) will- just -die in battle! And our(incl) enemy, they will-make our(incl) wives and our(incl) children slaves.> But Moses, Aaron, Josue and Caleb, they asked-mercy/pleaded to the Israelites, they-said, <<Don't you(PL) go-against/oppose God.>> But the Israelites, they spoke, the-said, <<We(excl) don't want that you(PL) will-lead us(excl). Better that we(excl) return to Egipto!>>

God was very angry, and His presence appeared at the Tent of Meeting. God said, “Except for Joshua and Caleb, all of the people who are twenty years old or older will wander in the wilderness until they die. They will never enter the Promised Land.”Ket hilay Israelita, ondagan la yayna dayin dapah ye Moises. Hiyay Apo Dioh, napoot yan tobat. Kapipikhaan, hiyay kahnagan nan Apo Dioh a ampakapolag, nikakaanti yayna ha toldan panggalangan. Ha nakit lan Israelita ye kahnagan a ampakapolag, ket hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanan Moises, a wana, “Hilay totoan Israelita a lowampo a taon ye edad patagay, ket ahe hilayna makahlep ha logal a impangako ko. Magpabalang-balang hilayna ha wangwang angga ha matey hilayna. Noba hilay main edad lowampo paaypa boy hiyay Josue boy Caleb ye makahlep ha logal a impangako ko.”BT - And the Israelites, they will-drop stones (desire particle) on Moises. God, he was very angry. Suddenly, the brightness of God which is-shining, it was present now at the tent of worshipping-place. When the Israelites saw the shining light, God spoke to Moises, he-said, <<The elder Israelites who are twenty years age going-up, they can- not -enter the place I promised. They will-wander-around in the deserted-place until they will-die. But those aged twenty and below and Josue and Caleb are the ones who will-be-able-to-enter the place I promised.>>

When the people heard this, they were sorry they had sinned. They took their weapons and went to attack Canaan. Moses warned them not to go because God was not with them, but they did not listen to him.Ha nange lan Israelita yatin hinabi nan Apo Dioh, nilomele hila. Ket paholong ye pagkahalanan la, ta kingwa lay almah la boy dinawohong la hilay Cananeo, agya ahe na hilan nilamoan nan Apo Dioh. Noba hiyay Moises, hinaad na hila, a wana kanla, “Adi kawoyna ampakew.” Noba homain nanlenge kana.BT - When the Israelites heard this that God said, they became-sad. And their sinning continued, for they took their arms/weapons and they attacked the Cananeo(PL), even-though God did not companion-with them. But Moises, he told-to-stop, he-said to-them, <<Don't you(PL) go.>> But none listened to-him.

God did not go with them into this battle, so they were defeated and many of them were killed. Then the rest of the Israelites turned back from Canaan and wandered through the wilderness for forty years.Ket hiyay Apo Dioh, agna hila nilamoan ye Israelita a makew makilaban kanlan Cananeo. Kaya-bay nahambot hila boy malabong ye natey kanla. Ket hilay Israelitan napatla a nakilaban, nagbalang-balang hilayna ha wangwang ha loob nin apatapo a taon.BT - God, he did not companion-with the Israelites to go fight those Cananeo. Therefore they were-defeated and many of them died. And the Israelites left from the battle, they wandered-around in the deserted-place forty years.

During that time of wandering, God provided for them. He gave them bread from heaven, called “manna.” He also sent quail (a kind of bird) into their camp so they could have meat to eat. During those forty years, God kept their clothes and shoes from wearing out.Ha pagbalang-balang lan Israelitan napatla, ket kinalingay na hila met ateed nin Apo Dioh. Minamangaamot na hilan ambyan nin tinapay a ibat ha langit a anhabtan “manna”. Boy ambyan na hila met nin aabeng ta omon hila makakena. Ket hiyay hapatoh la boy bado la, ahe bega nadonot ha loob nin apatapo a taon, oli ha pangalingay nan Apo Dioh kanla.BT - When the remaining Israelites are-wandering-around, God still took-care-of them. Everyday he is-giving them bread from heaven which is-being-called "manna". And he also is-giving them quails that they will-be-able-to-eat-meat. And their shoes and their clothes, were not at all worn-out inside of 40 years, because of the caring-for them of God.

God even miraculously gave them water from a rock. But despite all this, the people of Israel complained and grumbled against God and against Moses. God was still faithful to His promises to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.Hilay Israelita, agya anti hila ha wangwang, binyanan na hilan Apo Dioh nin lanom. Noba hilay Israelita, ampaytatalabotoban la yay Moises boy Apo Dioh. Noba agya wanabay man, mikakaanti ya po ateed ye pangakon Apo Dioh kalla a impangako na kanan Abraham, Isaac, boy Jacob ha hatew.BT - The Israelites, even-though they are present in the deserted-place, Apo God gave them water. But the Israelites, they grumbled-against Moses and God. But even-though like-that, always-present still is the promise of God to-them which he promised to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in time-past.

One time, the people had no water. God told Moses, “Speak to the rock, and water will come out of it.” But Moses dishonored God in front of all the people by hitting the rock twice with a stick instead of speaking to it. Water came out of the rock for everyone to drink, but God was angry with Moses and said, “You will not enter the Promised Land.”Maghay mangaamot, homain hilan lanom a mainom. Hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanan Moises, <<Habiyen mo ihtew ha dapah a lomwah yay lanom kana boy pagkayadi, lomwah yay lanom.>> Noba ahe na hinombong ye hinabi nan Apo Dioh kana no aliwan binadog-badog na yan teken nin ikaloway okdo. Kapipikhaan, linomwah yay lanom kanan dapah. Kaya-bay nakainom hilay kaganaan a tatao. Noba napoot yay Apo Dioh kanan Moises. Hinabi na, <<Ahe kayna makahlep ha logal a impangako ko kanyo. Ta ahe mo hinbombong ye hinabi ko kamo.>>BT - One day, there was no water to drink. God spoke to Moises, <<(You) speak there to the rock that the water will-come-out of-it and afterwards, water will-come-out.>> But he did- not -follow/obey what God told him but rather he-struck-with walking-stick two times. Suddenly, water came-out of the rock. Therefore all people were-able-to-drink. But God was-angry with Moises. He said, <<You can- not -enter the place I promised to-you(PL). For you did not follow/obey what I told to-you.>>

After they had wandered in the wilderness for forty years, all the people who had rebelled against God were dead. God led the Israelites to the edge of the Promised Land again. Moses was now very old, so he chose Joshua to help him lead the people. God promised Moses that one day He would raise up another prophet like Moses.Pangayadi nin pagbalang-balang la ha wangwang ha loob nin apatapo a taon, ket homain anan totowan angkabi-ay a nagtaon nin maigit anemapo', ta nangamatey hilan kaganaan ha wangwang. Haanin, in-ogot na hilayna man nin Apo Dioh ha anggaan nin logal a impangako na kanla. Ket ha pamiabot la ha anggaan nin logal a impangako nan Apo Dioh kanla, ket matoa yaynan tobat ye Moises.BT - After their wandering-around in the deserted-place inside of forty years, there were no longer elders living aged above sixty, for they all died in the deserted-place. Now, God brought them to the edge of the place he promised to-them. When they arrived at the edge of the place God promised to-them, Moises was very old already.

God brought Moses to the top of a mountain so he could see the Promised Land. Moses saw the Promised Land but never entered it. Then Moses died, and the Israelites mourned for thirty days. Joshua became their new leader. Joshua was a good leader because he trusted and obeyed God.Ha anti hilayna ha anggaan nin logal a impangako nan Apo Dioh kanla, inlakew na yay Moises ha pitondolan ta omon na po matamolaw ye logal a impangako na bayo ya matey ye Moises. Ha natey yayna, ket hiyay Josue ye kahagilian nan mangona. Hiyay Josue, manged yan mangona ta ampanombong ya kanan Apo Dioh.BT - When they are present already at the edge of the place God promised to-them, he brought Moises to the mountain-peak in order that he will-see-from-distance the place he promised before Moises will-die. When he died, Josue is the replacement to lead. Josue, he was a good leader for he is-following/obeying God.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Exodus 16-17; Numbers 10-14; 20; 27; Deuteronomy 34
chapters.title: ** 14. Nagbalangbalang ha wangwang

frames.text: At last it was time for the Israelites to enter the Promised Land. Joshua sent two spies to the Canaanite city of Jericho. It was protected by strong walls. A prostitute named Rahab protected the spies and helped them escape because she believed God. They promised to protect Rahab and her family when Jericho was destroyed.Haanin, yatiyna ye panahon a looban lan Israelita ye logal a impangako nan Apo Dioh kanla. Kaya-bay hiyay Josue, namili yan loway lalaki boy hinabi na kanla, «Doyongen yoy banwan Jerico omon kawo maniem no mak-haw hilay kalaban tawo o ahe.»  Panlomateng la ihtew, nahagana la yay Rahab a babayin babayadan ha hatew. Noba haanin, namteg yayna kanan Apo Dioh. Kaya-bay,  hinaglapan na hilay lowan ihpiya omon la hila ahe makit nin hohondaloh ihtew.  Ket nagpangako hila met kana, «No lomoob kayiyna, adi ka angkalimo, ta homain mapano kanyon mipapamilya.”BT - Now, this now is the time that the Israelitas will-enter the place that God promised to-them. So Josue, he chose two men and he said to-them, <<(You-PL) stealthily-approach the town of Jerico that you(PL) will-observe if our(incl) enemies are strong or not.>> When- they- arrived there, they met Rahab who was a woman to-be-paid-for (euphemism for prostitute) in time-past. But now, she believed already in Apo God. So she helped the two spies that they will- not -be-seen by the soldiers there. And they also promised to-her, <<If we(excl) will-enter already, don't you be-afraid, for nothing will-happen to-your(PL) family-members.>>

To enter into the Promised Land, the Israelites had to cross the Jordan River. God told Joshua, “Have the priests go first.” When the priests’ feet touched the Jordan River, the water stopped flowing so the Israelites could cross over on dry ground.No lomoob hilay Israelita ha logal a impangako nin Apo Dioh kalla, homain hilan kanayon a danan no aliwan lomipay hila ha Kabatowan Jordan. Hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanan Josue, «Paonaen mo hilay papadi.» Ket ha itodak layna dayi ye bibitih lan papadi ha kabatowan, tampol yaynan namal-an ye danan la. Ha wanabay, nakalipay hila ha kabatowan, ta namal-an ye dinanan la palakew ha Jerico.BT - If the Israelites will-enter the place which Apo God promised them, there is no other way-through other than they will-cross-over the River Jordan. Apo God spoke to Josue, <<(You) cause-to-go-first the priests.>> And when the feet of the priests touched the river, quickly dried-up their going-through-way. In like-that, they were-able-to-cross-over the river, for became-dry where they passed-through going-to Jerico.

After the people crossed the Jordan River, God told Joshua how to attack the powerful city of Jericho. The people obeyed God. The soldiers and priests marched around the city of Jericho once a day for six days.Pamakalipay lan Israelita ha Kabatowan Jordan, hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanan Josue, «Dawohongen yoynay banwan Jerico. Hiyay ona mon dapaten, itobol yo hilay hohondaloh boy papadi yo a manliwod ha banwan Jerico, timinhan bengat a liwod ha loob nin anem a mangaamot.» Ket hinombong lay hinabi nan Apo Dioh.BT - When- the Israelites -crossed-over the River Jordan, Apo God spoke to Josue, <<(You-PL) attack the town of Jerico. The first you(sg) will-do, you(PL) send soldiers and your(PL) priests to go-around-outside of the town of Jerico, just one around inside of six days.>> And they followed/obeyed what Apo God said.

On the seventh day, they marched around the city seven times. On the last time around the city, the soldiers shouted while the priests blew on their trumpets.Ha ikapitoy mangaamot, ket nikapito hila po a okdo a nanliwod ha palibot nin banwa. Ha kahoyotan a panliwod la, legan ampantamboyok hilay papadi, ampangha hila met ye hohondaloh.BT - On the seventh day, seven times still they went-around the outside of the city. On the last going-around-outside of theirs, while the priests are-blowing-trumpet, the soldiers also shouted.

And the walls around the city fell down! The Israelites destroyed everything in the city as God had commanded. Only Rahab and her family were saved. They became part of the Israelites. When the rest of the Canaanites heard about what had happened to Jericho they were terrified.Ket ha pangha boy pantamboyok la, nadama ye impalinpin a dapah a impangalad la ha banwa. Dinama lan Israelita ye matiboen banwan Jerico Jerico ta wanabay ye imbilin nan Apo Dioh kanla. Noba hiyay Rahab boy pamilya na, homain napano kanla. Kaya-bay paibat kananyatew, nakimamagha hilayna kanlan Israelita. Ha nabalitaan nin kanayon a lalahi nin tatao ha Canaan ye dinyag lan Israelita ha banwan Jerico, nalimowan hilan tobat.BT - And in their shouting and blowing-trumpet, the stacked-upon stones which they-made-into-fence of the city were-destroyed. The Israelites destroyed the whole city of Jerico for like-that is what Apo God commanded to-them. But Rahab and her family, nothing happened to-them. Therefore from then, they united-with the Israelites. When other races/people-groups in Canaan heard what the Israelites did to the town of Jerico, they were-frightened very-much.

The Canaanite tribe of Gibeon lied to Joshua and said they were from far away. They asked Joshua to make peace with them. God had commanded the Israelites not to make peace with any Canaanites, but Joshua and the Israelites did not ask God where the Gibeonites were from. So Joshua made peace with them.Hilay mahaley ihtew a tatao, hilay anhabtan Gibeon a maghan kalahin tao. Noba tinago la hilay Israelita, a wanla, «Agya mataang kay kanyo, ket labay mi ye  makitagem kanyo.» Nalabay ya met ye Josue agya imbilin nan Apo Dioh ha hatew a ahe hila makitagem kanlan kanayon a kalahin tao ihtew ha Canaan.BT - The people near there, they are-being-called Gibeon which is one race/descent of people. But they lied-to the Israelites, they-said, <<Even-though we(excl) are far-away from you(PL), we(excl) want to make-ally/side-with you(PL).>> Josue also liked even-though Apo God commanded in time-past that they not ally-with/side-with the other clans of people there in Canaan.

When the other Canaanites heard that the Gibeonites had made peace with the Israelites, they joined their armies and attacked Gibeon. The Gibeonites sent a message to Joshua asking for help.Ha nabalitaan lan kanayon a kalahin tao ha Canaan ye dinyag lan anhabtan Gibeon, naymamagha hilan lomaban kanlan Gibeon. Ket hilay Gibeon, nangitobol hilan nangaanon tatao a makew kanan Josue ta habiyen la kana, «Josue, tageman yo kayin lomaban.»BT - When other clans of people in Canaan heard-news of what was-done by those being-called Gibeon, they united/became-one to-fight those Gibeon. And those Gibeon, they sent how many people to go to Josue and they will-say to-him, <<Josue, (you-PL) ally/side-with us(excl) to fight.>>

Joshua was angry that he had been tricked, but he gathered the Israelite army, and they marched all night to reach the Gibeonites. In the early morning they surprised their Canaanite enemies and attacked them.Haanin, natandaan nan Josue a hilay Gibeon, mahaley manayti ye logal la kanlan Israelita. Ket napoot yay Josue, ta aliwan peteg ye hinabi la ha hatew. Noba in-ihip na, a wana, «Agya po man tinago la kayi, ket haglapan tawo hilan teed, ta nakitagem hila kantawo» wana ha ihip na. Kaya-bay tinipon nay hohondaloh na. Ket ha padeglem, kinomodang hilan palakew ha logal lan Gibeon. Ha pahanib, ikana la hilaynan labanan ye kanayon a kalahin tao a anlomaban kanlan Gibeon.BT - Now, Josue knew that those Gibeon, close (surprise particle) is their place to the Israelites. And Josue became-angry, for not true is what they said in time-past. But he thought, he-said, <<Even-though they lied-to/deceived us(excl), we(incl) will-help them anyway, for they allied/sided-with us(incl)>> he-said in his thought. Therefore he gathered-together his soldiers. And when evening, they walked going-toward the place of those Gibeon. When morning, they began to-fight-against the other clans of people who are-fighting-against those Gibeon.

God threw the Canaanites into confusion. God fought for Israel that day by sending large hailstones that killed many of the Canaanites.Ha pandowohong lan Israelita, nanaglap yay Apo Dioh kanla. Ket ha main anan antomakah, hiyay dinyag nan Apo Dioh, namaodan yan mangayadet a tabolinaw a namatey kanlan kalaban lan Israelita.BT - When the Israelites attacked, Apo God helped them. And when there are now [some] escaping, what Apo God did, he caused-to-rain large hail which killed the enemies of the Israelites.

God also made the sun stand still in the sky so that Israel could finish defeating the Canaanites. God won a great victory for Israel that day.Hiyay Apo Dioh, pinatgen nay tige nin mangaamot ta omon ya magboyot ye henag omon la hila mahipet ye kalaban la. Ket oli ha panaglap nan Apo Dioh, nanambot hilay Israelita ha labanan.BT - Apo God, he caused-to-stop the movement of the sun in order that the light will-be-long-time that they will-wipe-out (lit. consume) their enemies. And because of the helping of Apo God, the Israelites won in the battle.

After this defeat, the rest of the Canaanites who were left gathered together to attack Israel. Joshua and the Israelites attacked and destroyed them.Pangayadi nin panambot lan Israelita, hilay napatla a Cananeo, naymamagha hilay naman a lomaban kanlan Israelita. Noba hiyay Josue boy hohondaloh na, hinambot la hilay Cananeo.BT - When-finished is the defeating of the Israelites, those remaining who are Cananaeo, they united/became-one again to fight-against the Israelites. But Josue and his soldiers, they defeated those Cananeo.

After this battle, God gave each tribe of Israel their own section of the Promised Land. Then God gave Israel peace along all its borders.Pangayadi ye labanan, dinakay-dakay nan Apo Dioh ye logal a impangako na kanlan labinlowan lalahin tataon Israelita. Ket balang lalahin tataon Israelita, natanggap lay hadili lan logal. Ket hiyay Apo Dioh, pinatana na hilay lalahi nin tatao ha palibot nin ilwah nin Canaan.BT - After the battle, Apo God divided/apportioned the place which he promised to those twelve clans of the people of Israelites. And each clan of people of Israelites, they received their own place. And Apo God, he caused-be-peaceful the clans of people around the outside of Canaan.

When Joshua was an old man, he called all the people of Israel together. Then Joshua renewed the covenant that God had made with the Israelites at Sinai. The people promised to remain faithful to God and follow his laws.Ha matowa yaynay Josue, tinipon na hilay kaganaan a Israelita. Hinabi nayna man kanla ye bibilin boy papangako nan Apo Dioh kanlan Israelita ha anti hila ha Mapantay nin Sinai.  Nagpangako hila ha balang magha, «Magpaholong kitawon magpakapeteg kanan Apo Dioh boy manombong kitawo ha bibilin na.»When Josue was old already, he gathered all the Israelites. He spoke again to-them the commands and promises of Apo God to the Israelites when they are present on the Mountain of Sinai. They promised, <<We(incl) will-continue to be-true to Apo God and we(incl) will-follow/obey his commands.>>

After Joshua died, the Israelites disobeyed God and did not drive out the rest of the Canaanites or obey God’s laws. The Israelites began to worship the Canaanite gods instead of the One True God. The Israelites had no king, so everyone did what they thought was right for them.Ha panaon nan Josue, ampanombong hilay Israelita ha kalabayan nan Apo Dioh. Noba ha natey yayna, ahe la hinombong ye bilin nan Apo Dioh kanla boy ahe layna pinaalih ye kaganaan a kalahin tataon angkomonin ihtew ha Canaan. No aliwan, nakitowad hilaynan nanggalang ha dioh-diohan  lan kalahin tataon angkomonin ihtew. Kananyatew a panaon, homain hilan poon ye Israelita. Kaya-bay kalabayan laynan bengat ye andiyagen nin balang magha kanla.BT - In the time of Josue, the Israelites are-following/obeying the will/desire of Apo God. But when he died, they did not follow/obey the commands of Apo God to-them and they did not cause-to-leave all the clans of people living there in Canaan. But rather they imitated honoring/worshipping the false-gods of the clans of people living there. At that time, the Israelites have no ruler. So just their will/desire only is what each one of them is doing.

As a result of this disobedience, God punished the Israelites by allowing them to be defeated by their enemies. These enemies stole from the Israelites, destroyed their property, and killed many of them. After many years, the Israelites repented and asked God to rescue them.Oli ha kabyangan nin ō lan Israelita, hiyay Apo Dioh, pinalobohan na hilan hamboten nin kaaway la. Ket hilatin kaaway la, tinakaw boy dinama lay babandi lan Israelita. Boy pinatey la hilay kanayon kanla. Pangalabah nin mangaanoy taon a kaidapan la, nakigwang hila kanan Apo Dioh, a wanla, <<Apo Dioh, amgpaghehean mi ye kakahalanan mi kammo. Kaya-bay patawaden mo kayi dayi. Ampakiiingalo kayi kammo a iligtah mo kayi kanlan kaaway mi!>>BT - Because of the hardness of the heads of the Israelites, Apo God, he allowed that their enemies will-defeat them. And these enemies of theirs, they stole and destroyed the possessions/wealth of the Israelites. And they killed some of them. After how many years of their hardship, they prayed to Apo God, they-said, <<Apo God, we(excl) are-repenting of our(excl) sins to-you. So (you) forgive us (excl) (desire particle). We(excl) are-asking-mercy to-you that you save us(excl) from our(excl) enemies!>>

Then God provided a deliverer who rescued them from their enemies and brought peace to the land. But then the people forgot about God and started worshiping idols again. So God allowed the Midianites, a nearby enemy tribe, to defeat them.Kaya-bay oli ha pangingalo nan Apo Dioh ha hinabi lan Israelita, magha met ateed kanlan Israelita ye pinili nan mangiligtah la. Noba angkaliwaan layna man ye Apo Dioh ket nanggalang hilayna man ha diohdiohen. Kaya-bay impaloboh nan Apo Dioh a manambot hilay Midianita kanla.BT - So because of the mercy of Apo God at what the Israelites said, one also again of the Israelita is whom he chose as their savior. But they are-forgetting Apo God and they honored again false-gods. So Apo God allowed that the Midianita will-defeat them.

They took all of the Israelites’ crops for seven years. The Israelites were so scared, they hid in caves so the Midianites would not find them. Finally, they cried out to God to save them.Nahakop hilan Midian ye Israelita ha loob nin pitoy taon. Ket ha loob nin hilain a taon, hilay Midianita ye ampangwa nin aapit la. Ket hilay Israelita, oli ha limo la, ampagtayo hila ha yoyokib ta omon la hilan ahe makitan lan Midianita. Ha kalinghoyotan, ket nakiingalo hilayna man kanan Apo Dioh, a wanla, <<Apo Dioh, amgpaghehean mi ye kakahalanan mi kammo. Kaya-bay patawaden mo kayiyna man. Ampakiiingalo kayi kammo a iligtah mo kayi kanlan kalaban mi!>>BT - The Israelites came-to-be-under-jurisdiction of the Midianiates inside of seven years. And inside those years, the Midianites are the ones getting their harvest. And the Israelitas, because of their fear, they are-hiding in caves in order that they will- not -be-seen by the Midianites. At the end, they asked-mercy again to Apo God, they-say, <<Apo God, we(excl) are-repenting of our(excl) sins to-you. Therefore (you) forgive us(excl) again. We(excl) are-asking-mercy to-you that you save us(excl) from our(excl) enemies!>>

One day, a man named Gideon was secretly harvesting grain so the Midianites would not steal it. The angel of God came to Gideon and said, “God is with you, mighty warrior. Go and save Israel from the Midianites.”Ha maghay mangaamot, intobol na yan Apo Dioh ye pānobolen na ha maghay lāki a nagngalan Gideon. Hiyay Gideon, ampagtayo yan ampanggiek, ta angkalimo ya kanlan Midianita. Hinabi nan panobolen kanan Gideon, a wana, “Gideon, minged ka, ta hika ye mak-haw a hondaloh. Pinili na kan Apo Dioh a māngiligtah kanlan Israelita.”BT - One day, Apo God sent his sent-one to go to a man who was-named Gideon. Gideon, he is-hiding threshing-[grain], for he is-afraid of the Midianita. The sent-one spoke to Gideon, he-said, “Gideon, you will-be-gooded, for you are a strong soldier. Apo God chose you to save the Israelites.”

God told Gideon to tear down his father’s idol. Gideon was afraid of the people, so he waited until nighttime. Then he tore down the idol and smashed it to pieces. He built an altar to God where the idol used to be and made a sacrifice to God.Hinabi na po nin pānobolen, a wana, “Imbilin nan Apo Dioh a damaen moy andiohen nan bapa mo.” Noba hiyay Gideon, angkalimo ya kanlan tatao. Kaya-bay pinakadeglem na po. Ket ha madeglem ana, dinama nan Gideon ye andiohen nan bapa na haka na tinemek-temek. Pangayadi, ha nangipalontoan nin andiohen nan bapa na, nanyag yan pangihagpaan. Ket nangihagpa yan digalo kanan Apo Dioh. BT - The sent-one still spoke, “Apo God commanded that (you) destroy what your father is-worshipping.” But Gideon, he is-being-afraid to the people. So he still waited-til-night. When evening already, Gideon destroyed what his father is-worshipping and he crushed/smashed [it]. Afterwards, on the putting-on-top-of-place ofwhat his father is-worshipping, he made a altar (lit. setting-down-place). And he set-down/offered a gift to Apo God.

The next morning the people saw that the idol had been torn down, and they were very angry. They went to Gideon’s house to kill him, but Gideon’s father said, “Why are you trying to help your gods? If they are gods, let them protect themselves!” So Gideon was saved.Kabekahan, nakit lan tatao a nadama ana ye andiohen la. Ket napoot hilan tobat. Kaya-bay nakew hila ha baey nan Gideon, ta labay la yan pateyen. Noba hinabi nan bapa nin Gideon, a wana, “Taket ta anhaglapan yoy dioh? No peteg a dioh ya, paolayan yo man awod a hiyabay ye mamae kanan Gideon.” Oli yatin hinabi na, pinaolayan la yan teed. Kaya-bay, naligtah yay Gideon.BT - Next-morning, people saw that destroyed is what they are-worshipping. And they were very angry. So they went to the house of Gideon, for they wanted to kill him. But the father of Gideon spoke, he-said, “Why are you helping god? If true that he is god, (you-PL) leave-alone then that he will-take-revenge to Gideon.” Because of this he said, they then left- him -alone. So, Gideon was-saved.

Then the Midianites came again to steal from the Israelites. There were so many of them that they could not be counted. Gideon called the Israelites together to fight them. Gideon asked God for two signs so he could be sure that God would use him to save Israel.Ha ahe maboyot, anti hilay naman ye Midianita a mangwa nin apit lan Israelita. Ahe mabilang-bilang ye kalabongan la. Ket hiyay Gideon, hinagyat na hilay Israelita a lomaban kanlan Midianita. Noba bayo hilan linomaban, hiyay Gideon, nakikwa yan pagkakitan kanan Apo Dioh, no a hiyabay ye gawien na a māngiligtah kanlan Israelita. BT - Not long-time, those Midian are present to get the harvest of the Israelita. Not be-counted is their being-many. And Gideon, he invited the Israelites to oppose those Midianites. But before they fought, Gideon, he asked sign to Apo God, if he is the one he will-use as savior to the Israelites.

First, he laid a cloth on the ground and asked God to let the morning dew fall only on the cloth and not on the ground. God did that. The next night, he asked that the ground be wet but the cloth dry. God did that too.Hiyay ona nan dinyag, nangiamlak yan tapih ha lota. Pangayadi, inawok na kanan Apo Dioh, a wana, “Apo, no hikoy pinili mo, biyan mo kon pagkakitan. Palobohan mon mabaha nin ambon yatin tapih, noba hiyay lota ha palibot na ket ahe.” Ket dinyag nan Apo Dioh ye inawok na. Ha domondon a madeglem, inawok nay naman, a wana, “Apo, no hikoy peteg a pinili mo, biyan mo koyna man nin pagkakitan. Palobohan mo a palibot nin tapih bengat ye mabaha, adi ana mabaha ye tapih.” Ket dinyag nayna man Apo Dioh ye inawok nan Gideon kana.BT - The first that he did, he laid down cloth on the ground. Afterwards, he requested to Apo God, he-said, “Apo, if I am the one you chose, (you) give me a sign. (You) allow to become-wet the cloth by the dew, but the ground around it, don't [be-wet].” And Apo God did what he requested. The next night, requested again to Apo God, he-said, “Apo, if I am truly the one you chose, (you) give me a sign. (You) allow that around the cloth only will-be-wet, not be-wet now the cloth.” And Apo God did again what Gideon requested to-him.

32,000 Israelite soldiers came to Gideon, but God told him this was too many. So Gideon sent home 22,000 who were too scared to fight. God told Gideon that he still had too many men. So Gideon sent all of them home except for 300 soldiers.Main 32,000 hondaloh lan Israelita ye nakew kanan Gideon.
