Noba hinabi nan Apo Dioh kana, a wana, “Bawahan mo hila, ta malabong hilan tobat.” Ket hiyay Gideon, pinaoli nay 22,000 a angkalimon makilaban. Noba hinabi na po nin Apo Dioh kana, a wana, “Hali po, bawahan mo po, ta malabong hila po ateed.” Kaya-bay pinaoli na hilay  kanayon po angga ha 300 anan bengat ye napatla.BT - There were 32,000 soldiers of the Israelitas who went to Gideon. But Apo God said to-him, he-said, “(You) lessen them, for they are very many.” And Gideon, he sent-home 22,000 soldiers who were afraid to fight. But Apo God spoke again to-him, he-said, “Still [too many], (you) lessen still your soldiers, for they still are many.” So Gideon sent-home again other soldiers until 300 only were-left.

That night God told Gideon, “Go down to the Midianite camp and when you hear what they say, you will no longer be afraid.” So that night, Gideon went down to the camp and heard a Midianite soldier telling his friend about a dream. The man’s friend said, “This dream means that Gideon will defeat Midian!” Gideon worshiped God.Kananyatew a madeglem, hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanan Gideon, a wana, “Makew kan maniem ha kampo lan Midianita. Ket no malenge moy anhabiyen la, homain kaynan limo.” Kaya-bay hiyay Gideon, nakew yan naniem ha kampo lan Midianita. Ket ha anti yayna ihtew, nange nay maghay hondalo a ampangihabi nin taynep na kanan kalamo na. Hinabi nan kalamo na, a wana, “Hiyay labay habiyen nin taynep mo, ket hamboten la kitawon Gideon.” Ha nange nan Gideon ye yatew, nanggalang ya kanan Apo Dioh. BT - That night, Apo God spoke to Gideon, “(You) go to the camp of the Midian. If you will-hear what they are-saying, you have no more fear.” So Gideon, he went to the camp of his enemies at night. And he arrived-on a soldier who was-awake speaking his dream to a soldier who is his companion. And he spoke to his companion, “The meaning to say of your dream, Gideon(PL) will-defeat us(incl).” And when Gideon heard what the soldiers are-talking-about in the camp, he worshipped/praised Apo God.

Then Gideon returned to his soldiers and gave each of them a horn, a clay pot, and a torch. They surrounded the place where the Midianites were sleeping. The 300 men had the torches in the pots so they could not be seen.Haanin, nag-odong yaynay Gideon kanlan hohondaloh na, ket binyanan na hilan titimaghan tamboyok, koden boy tinlag. Pangayadi, pinalibotan lay kampo lan Midianiata a angkatoloy po. Ket hilay 300 a hohondaloh na, hinalokoban lan koden ye tinlag la omon ya ahe makit.BT - Now, Gideon returned already to his soldiers, and he gave them each a trumpet, a pot and torch. Afterwards, they surrounded the camp of the Midianita who are-sleeping still. And his 300 soldiers, they covered their torches with pots that it will- not -be-seen.

Then, at the same time, they all broke the pots that were hiding the torches. They blew their horns and shouted, “A sword for God and for Gideon!”Ha napalibotan la hilaynay Midianita, nayngingidlan hilan namatnoy nin tamboyok la haka la pinha ye koden a nakahalokob ha tillag la. Boy impangha la, a wanla, “Oli kanan Apo Dioh boy kanan Gideon, tawoyna!”BT - When had surrounded the Midianites, at-same-time they made-noise with their trumpets and they broke the pot which they [used] to-cover-up their torches. And they shouted, they-said, “Because of Apo God and Gideon, let's go!”

God confused the Midianites, so that they attacked each other and started killing each other. Immediately, the rest of the Israelites were called from their homes to come help chase the Midianites. They killed many of them and chased the rest of them out of their land. 120,000 Midianites died that day. God had saved Israel.Ket hiyay Apo Dioh, nilimang-limang nay ihip lan Midianita ta omen hila met ateed ye naypateyan boy nipapayew hilay kanayon. Hilay kanayon a Israelita, kinamat la hilan pinatey ye nipapayew. Main 120,000 a Midianita ye natey kananyatew a mangaamot.  Hilay napatla, intaboy la hila ha ilwah nin logal la. Ket ha wanabay, hiyay Apo Dioh ye namahambot kanlan Israelita.BT - And Apo God, he confused the minds/thinking of the Midianites so that they also killed-each-other and others ran-away-from-each-other. Other Israelites, they caught-up-with them and killed the ones running-away. There were 120,000 Midianites who died that day. Those left, they drove them outside their place. And in like-that, Apo God caused- Israelites -to-win/triumph.

The people wanted to make Gideon their king. Gideon wisely refused their offer, but he asked them for some of the money that each of them had taken from the enemy. Gideon received a lot of money.Haanin, hinabi lan Israelita kanan Gideon, a wanla, “Labay mi a hika ye mamoon kammi.”Noba hinabi nan Gideon kanla, a wana, “Ahe ko labay ye mamoon kanyo. Biyan yo koynan bengat nin pilak ha nahamham yo kanlan kakaaway tawo.” Ket malabong a pilak boy balitok ye in-ibyay la kana. Now, the Israelites spoke to Gideon, they-said, “We(excl) want that you will be the one to rule us(excl).”But Gideon spoke to-them, he-said, “I don't want to rule-over you(PL). (You-PL) just give me money from what  you(PL) snatched from our(incl) enemies.” And many are the money and gold which they gave to-him.

Then Gideon did a foolish thing. He made an idol with the money, and the people turned away from God again. They started worshiping Gideon’s idol.Pangayadi, hiyay Gideon, nanyag yan aliwan manged ha pamilew nan Apo Dioh. Ta hiyay pilak boy balitok a natanggap na, ket dinyag na yan diohdiohan. Oli ha dinyag nan Gideon nin diohdiohan, ket tinomalingkokol hilaynay Israelita kanan Apo Dioh boy tinowad la yay Gideon a ampanggalang ha diohdiohan.BT - Afterwards, Gideon, he did not good in the sight of Apo God. For the money and gold which he received, he made a false-god. Because Gideon made a false-god, the Israelites turned-away-from Apo God and they imitated Gideon who is-honoring/worshipping a false-god.

God punished Israel again for worshiping idols. Their enemies defeated them. They finally asked God for help, and God sent them another deliverer. This pattern of sin, punishment, repentance, and deliverance was repeated many times. God sent many deliverers who saved Israel from their enemies.Haanin, bilang padoha nan Apo Dioh kanlan Israelita, nahambot hilayna man kanlan kaaway la. Kaya-bay nakiingalo hilayna man kanan Apo Dioh, a wanla, “Apo Dioh, amgpaghehean mi ye kakahalanan mi kammo. Kaya-bay patawaden mo kayiyna man. Ampakiiingalo kayi kammo a iligtah mo kayi kanlan kalaban mi!” Ket oli ha paghehe lan Israelita, nangitobol yayna man ye Apo Dioh nin kanayon a mangiligtah kanla. Yatin andiyagen lan Israelita a magkahalanan, mapadohaan, maghehe bayo iligtah na hilan Apo Dioh, ket malabong anan okdo. BT - Now, as punishment of Apo God to the Israelites, they were-defeated again by their enemies. So they asked-mercy again to Apo God, they-said, “Apo God, we(excl) are-repenting of our(excl) sins to-you. Therefore (you) forgive us(excl) again. We(excl) are-asking-mercy to-you that you will-save us(excl) from our(excl) enemies!” And because of their repenting, Apo God sent again other saviors/deliverers to them. This being-done by the Israelites that sin, be-punished, repent before Apo God will-save them, many times now.

Finally, the people asked God for a king like all the other nations had. They wanted a king who was tall, strong, and could lead them into battle. God did not like this request, but He gave them what they wanted.Ha kapopohan, hinabi lan Israelita kanan Apo Dioh, a wanla, “Apo, hilay kaganaan a kalahin tatao ha palibot mi ket main hilan poon. Labay dayi Apo, a biyan mo kayi met nin pagpoon mi. Ket no malyadi dayi, matagay ya, makhaw boy makpen mangona kammi ha labanan.”Hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanla, a wana, “Ahe ko nalabayan ye hinabi yo. Noba agya wanabay man, ibyay ko kanyo ye awok yo.”BT - At the end, the Israelites spoke to Apo God, they-said, “All the kinds/clans of people in our(excl) surrounding, they have rulers. [We] want (desire particle) Apo, that you(sg) will-give also to be our(excl) ruler. And if possible (desire particle), he is tall, strong and persevering to lead in battle.”Apo God spoke to-them, he-said, “I don't like what you said. But even-though like-that, I will-give you(PL) your(PL) request.”

Saul was the first king of Israel. He was tall and handsome, just like the people wanted. Saul did well at first, but he became a wicked man who did not obey God, so God chose a different man who would one day be king in his place.Main lāki ha Israel a nagngalan Saulo. Matagay ya boy manged yan laki. Hiya ye onan pagpoon ha Israel. Hiyay Saulo, ha babayon yan nikno a manakop kanla, manged ye andyagen na, noba ha kaboyotan nan ampanakop, nag-ilyadi yan malambong boy ahe yayna ampanombong ha kalabayan nan Apo Dioh. Kaya-bay oli ha kalok-an a dinyag nan Saulo, namili yayna man ye Apo Dioh nin kahagili na a mamoon kanlan Israelita.BT - There was a man in Israel who was-named Saulo. He is tall and good [looking] man. He is first ruler of Israel. Saulo, when he first sat to have-jurisdiction to-them, good is what he is-doing, but in the long-time of his having-jurisdiction, he became proud and he is- not -now following/obeying the will/desire of Apo God. So because of the evil which Saulo did, Apo God chose again his replacement who will-rule the Israelites

This man’s name was David. He was a shepherd from the town of Bethlehem. While watching the sheep, David had killed both a lion and a bear which had attacked the sheep. David was a humble and righteous man who trusted and obeyed God.Ket hiyay David ye pinili nan Apo Dioh a kahagiliyan nan Saulo a mamoon kanla. Hiyay David, magha yan pahtol nin aayop. Noba bayo ya namoon kanlan Israelita, wanae ye nalyadi. Legan ampagpahtol yan topa, nakit na hilay mangatobag a ayop a mandoyong kanlan topa na. Ket hiyay dinyag nan David, pinatey na hilay mangatobag a aayop ta main yan kakpehan. Noba hiyay David, magmakaaypa ya, matoynong, boy ampamteg ya kanan Apo Dioh.BT - And David is the one Apo God chose as the replacement of Saulo who will-rule them. David, he is a pastor/shepherd of animals. But before he ruled the Israelites, like-this is what happened. While he is-pastoring/shepherding the sheep, he saw wild animals attacking his sheep. And what David did, he killed the wild animals for he has perseverance/courage. But David, he is humble, righteous, and he is-believing Apo God.

David was also a great soldier and leader. When David was still a young man, he fought against a giant named Goliath. Goliath was a trained soldier, very strong, and almost three meters tall! But God helped David kill Goliath and save Israel.Ha bayontawo yay David, main hilan kalaban ye Israelita a nagngalan Goliat. Hiyay Goliat, kaginta a lāki boy magha yan hondaloh a magaling, makpeh boy mak-haw ya. Hiyay katagayan na, maigit 3 mitodo! Ket agya kotiti yay David, linabanan na yay Goliat. Noba hinaglapan na yan Apo Dioh ye David a mamatey kanan Goliat, a agya palhiit bengat ye ginawi na, ket natey yay Goliat. Kaya-bay nailigtah hilay Israelita kanlan kalaban la. BT - When David is young-man, the Israelites have an enemy who was-named Goliat. Goliat, [is] a large man and he is a soldier who is skilled, brave/persevering and strong. His height, greater than 3 meters! And even-though David is very-small, he fought-against Goliat. But Apo God helped David to kill Goliat that even sling only is what he used. Therefore the Israelites were-saved from their enemies.

Saul became jealous of David and tried many times to kill him. One day Saul was looking for David so he could kill him. Saul went into the same cave where David was hiding but did not see him. Instead of killing Saul, David cut off a piece of his clothes to prove to Saul that he would not kill him to become king.Hiyay Poon Saulo, tobat ye imon na kanan David boy nikaano na yaynan pihahapda a pateyen. Ha maghay mangaamot, nakew yan nanoday ye Saulo ha ampagtayoan nan David. Noba hiyay Saulo, ahe na ya angkakit ye David. Noba hiyay David, angkakit na yay Saulo, ket malyadi na yayna dayin pateyen, noba ahe na dinapat no aliwan pinapakana na yan iniwa nin makandin bengat ye badon hoot nan Saulo. Ta ahe na labay a makaoli ha pamatey na, ket mag-ilyadi yan poon.   BT - Ruler Saulo, great is his envy to David and many [times] he is-planning/scheming to kill. One day, Saulo went to urinate at the hiding-place of David. But Saulo, he did not see David. But David, he is-seeing Saulo, and can (desire particle) kill him, but he did not do it but rather slowly he just cut-with-knife small [part] of the clothes of Saulo. For he did not want that because of his killing, he will-become ruler.

Eventually, Saul died in battle, and David became king of Israel. He was a good king, and the people loved him. God blessed David and made him successful. David fought many battles and God gave him victory. David conquered Jerusalem and made it his capital. During David’s reign, Israel became powerful and wealthy.Ha naboboyot makandi, natey yay Saulo ha maghay labanan. Haanin, malyadi yaynan mikno ye David a poon lan Israel. Manged yan pagpoon boy kalabaylabay la yan tatao. Hiyay David, in-inged na yan Apo Dioh. Kaya-bay nikalabong yan nanambot ha labanan. Ha nanakop ya ha banwan Jerusalem, linamoan na yan Apo Dioh. Kaya-bay hiyay banwan Jerusalem ye nag-ilyadin capitulyo nin Israel. Ha panaon a pamoon nan David, ket nag-ilyadin makapalyadiyan boy mabandi ye matiboen logal a Israel. BT - After a little while (lit. When long-time little), Saulo died in a battle. Now, David can sit as ruler of Israel. He is good in ruling and the people like him. David, he was-gooded-to by Apo God. Therefore many he won in battle. When he took-jurisdiction of the town of Jerusalem, Apo God companioned-with him. Therefore the town of Jerusalem became the capitol of Israel. In the time of the ruling of David, the whole place of Israel became powerful and wealthy.

David wanted to build a temple where everybody could worship God and offer him sacrifices. For about 400 years, the people had been worshiping God and offering sacrifices to him at the Tent of Meeting that Moses had built.Hatew, ha loob nin 400 a taon, hiyay Tabirnakolo a pikakaget lan Israelita ye anggawien lan panggalangan boy pangihagpaan nin idigalo la kanan Apo Dioh. Noba haanin, hiyay Poon David, labay nay mangipaideng nin maghen a mayadet a panggalangan kanan Apo Dioh a anhabtan Templo.BT - In time-past, inside of 400 years, the Tabirnakolo which the Israelites are-carrying-around is what they are-using to honor/worship and setting-down-place of what they will-give-as-gift to Apo God. But now, Ruler David, he wants to build (lit. cause-to-stand) a firm big worship/honoring-place to Apo God which is being-called Templo.

God sent the prophet Nathan to David with this message, “Because you are a man of war, you will not build this house for me. Your son will build it. But, I will bless you greatly. Someone from your family will always sit on the throne of Israel, and the Messiah will be one of your descendants!” The Messiah is God’s Chosen One who would save the world from sin.Noba intobol na yan Apo Dioh ye propetan Natan a makew kanan Poon David. Hinabi nan Natan kanan David, a wana, “Wanae ye hinabi nan Apo Dioh kangko a habiyen ko kammo. Oli ta hondaloh ka boy nakapatey ka, aliwan hikay malyadin manyag baey nan Apo Dioh, no aliwan hiyay anak mo. Noba agya wanabay man, inged na kan teed nin Apo Dioh. Boy aliwa po bengat yain, ta hiyay lahi mo, hilabay bengat ye mikno ha pamiknoan nin poon lan Israelita. Boy mangibat ya ha lahi mo ye lomateng a Māngiligtah!”BT - But Apo God sent the prophet Natan to go to Ruler David. Natan spoke to David, he-said, <<Like-this is what Apo God said to-me that I will-say to-you. Because you are a soldier and you have-killed, not you can build the house of Apo God, but rather your child. But even-though like-that, Apo God still will-do-good-to you. And not just that, for your clan, they only are the ones who will-sit on the sitting-place of the ruler of the Israelita. And from your clan will-arrive the Savior!”

When David heard these words, he immediately thanked and praised God because he had promised David this great honor and many blessings. The Israelites would have to wait a long time before the Messiah came, almost 1,000 years.Ha nange nan David ye hinabi nan Natan, tampol yan nagpahalamat boy nanggalang kanan Apo Dioh oli ta impangako nan Apo Dioh kana a biyan na yan kangedan. Noba hilay Israelita, mangagad hila po nin malibon taon bayo ya lomateng kanla ye Māngiligtah la.BT - When David heard what Natan said, quickly he gave-thanks and honored/worshipped Apo God because Apo God promised to-him that he will-give him goodness. But the Israelita, they still will-wait one thousand years before their Messiah will-arrive.

David ruled with justice and faithfulness for many years, and God blessed him. However, toward the end of his life he sinned terribly before God.Manged ye pamoon nan David ha Israel. Matoynong ya boy in-inged na yan Apo Dioh. Agya wanabay man, ha kapopohan nin bi-ay na, nakadiyag yan mabyat a kahalanan ha adapan nan Apo Dioh.BT - Good is the ruling of David in Israel. He is righteous and Apo God did-good-to him. Even-though like-that, at the end of his life, he did a heavy sin before Apo God.

One day, when all of David's soldiers were out fighting, he got up from an afternoon nap and saw a beautiful woman bathing. Her name was Bathsheba.Ha maghay mahilem, legan anlomaban hilay hohondaloh na, angkatoloy yay David ha baey na. Ha nimata ya, nalonglongan na yan ampalyo ye Batseba a maada a babayi.BT - One afternoon, while his soldiers are-fighting, David is-sleeping at his house. When he woke-up, he glanced-down at Batseba bathing who is a beautiful woman.

Instead of looking away, David sent someone to bring her to him. He slept with her and sent her back home. A short time later Bathsheba sent a message to David saying that she was pregnant.Tanatana talingkokolan na ya dayi ye babayi, nagkamalih impakwa na ya. Ket ha inlateng la yay babayi, tinakeh na ya. Ha pamigantah na yan tinakeh, pinaoli na yayna. Ha ahe maboyot, impabalita nan Batseba a habiyen kanan David, a wana, “Pinaboktot mo ya, ket hikay bapa nan anak.” BT - Quickly he will-turn-back-on the woman (desire particle), but instead he caused-to-get her. And when they arrived-to him the woman, he hugged her (euphemism for sex). When he finished hugging her, he sent- her -home. When not long-time, Batseba caused-to-be-newsed that will-be-said to David, she-said, “You caused- her -to-be-pregnant, and you are the father of the child.”

Bathsheba's husband, Uriah, was one of David’s best soldiers. David called Uriah back from the battle and told him to go be with his wife. But Uriah refused to go home while the rest of the soldiers were in battle. So David sent Uriah back to the battle and told the general to place him where the enemy was strongest so that he would be killed.Hiyay Batseba, main yan ahawa a magha kanlan magaling a hondaloh nan Poon David. Hiyay ngalan na ket Urias. Hinagyat na yan David ye Urias a omalih ya ha labanan ta mag-odong ya ha Israel. Ha linomateng yayna kanan Poon David, hinabi nan David kana, “Moli kayna ha baey mo, ta id-an mo ya po ye ahawa mo.” Hinabi nan David yati ta omen na ahe mabaan nin Urias a tinakeh na yan David ye ahawa na. Noba hiyay Urias, ahe na labay ye mida ta an-ihipen nay kaidapan nin kalalamoan na a anlomaban. Kaya-bay hiyay David, hinolatan na yay opihyal nan Urias. Ket wanae ye nakaholat, “Ipadongla mo yay Urias ha labanan ta omon yan matey.” Ket hiyay opihyal, tinopad nay inholat nan David. Kaya-bay natey yay Urias ha labanan, agya po magaling ya.BT - Batseba, she has a husband who is one of the skilled soldiers of Ruler David. His name is Urias. David invited Urias to leave the battle for the will-return to Israel. When he arrived now to Ruler David, David said to-him, “(You) go-home to your house, for you will-lie-with (euphemism for sex) still your wife.” David spoke this in order that Urias will not think that David hugged (euphemism for sex) his wife.But Urias, he did not want to lie-with [her] for he is-thinking of the harship of his companions who are-fighting. So David, he wrote-to the official of Urias. And like-this is what was-written, “(You) cause-to-be-in-front Urias in battle in order that he will-die.” And the official, he fulfilled what David wrote. Therefore Urias died in battle, even-though still he is skilled.

After Uriah was killed, David married Bathsheba. Later, she gave birth to David's son. God was not pleased with what David had done, so he sent the prophet Nathan to show David his sin. David repented of his sin and God forgave him. For the rest of his life, David trusted God, even in difficult times.Ha natey yay Urias, hiyay dinyag nan Poon David, inahawa na yay Batseba. Ket inlomateng ye panaon, in-anak nay yaynay boktot na, ket magha yan ongi a lāki. Ket yatin panamham nin babayi boy pangipapatey a dinyag nan David, napoot yay Apo Dioh. Kaya-bay intobol na yayna man ye propetan Natan kanan David, a wana, “David, nagkahalanan ka kanan Apo Dioh.” Ha nange nan David ye hinabi nan Nathan, naghehe ya, ket pinatawad na ya met nin Apo Dioh. Paibat kananyatew, agya malabong ye kaidapan a angkadihaan na, namteg ya met ateed kanan Apo Dioh.BT - When Urias died, what Ruler David did, he married Batseba. And the time arrived, she gave-birth to what he was-pregnant with, and he is a baby boy. And this snatching of woman and killing which David did, Apo God became-angry. So he sent again the prophet Natan to David, he-said, “David, you sinned to Apo God.” When David heard what Natan said, he repented, and Apo God also forgave hime. From then, even-though many still are the harships he is-experiencing, he believed anyway in Apo God.

But as punishment for David's sin, his baby boy died. There was also fighting in David’s family for the rest of his life, and David’s power was greatly weakened. Though David had been unfaithful to God, God was still faithful to his promises. Bathsheba gave birth to another son named Solomon.Noba hiyay padoha a nadihaan na, natey yay anak nan David kanan Batseba boy naagwat ana met ye kapah-eyan nin pamoon na. Agya po man nakadyag yan kahalanan ha pamilew nan Apo Dioh, ket mapah-ey po ateed ye pangako nan Apo Dioh kana. Haanin, nagkaanak yan oman ye David kanan Batseba nin maghay lāki a pinangalanan lan Solomon.BT - But the punishment which he experienced, the child of David to Batseba died and the strength (lit. firmness) of his ruling was- also already -destroyed (lit. torn-down). Even-though still he did sin in the sight of Apo God, firm still is the promise of Apo God to-him. Now, David came-to-have child again to Batseba a male whom they named Solomon.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: 1 Samuel 10; 15-19; 24; 31; 2 Samuel 5; 7; 11-12
chapters.title: ** 17. God’s Covenant with David

frames.text: After David died, his son Solomon began to rule. God spoke to Solomon and asked him what he wanted most. When Solomon asked for wisdom, God was pleased and made him the wisest man in the world. God also made him very wealthy.Ha natey yay Poon David, hiyay anak na a nagngalan Solomon ye kahagiliyan na a manakop kanlan Israelita. Tinepet na yan Apo Dioh, a wana, <<Hinyay labay mon ibiyay ko kammo?>> Hinabi nan Solomon, a wana, <<Kadonongan, Apo, ye labay ko.>> Oli ta kadonongan ye labay nan Solomon, maaliket yay Apo Dioh, ket in-ibyay nan Apo Dioh. Ket hiyay Poon Solomon anay nag-ilyadin pinakamadonong a tao ihti ha babe lota boy pinabatnang na ya po nin Apo Dioh.BT - When Ruler David died, his child who was-named Solomon is his replacement to have-jurisdiction-over the Israelites. Apo God asked him, he said, <<What do you want I will-give you?>> Solomon spoke, he-said, <<Wisdom, Apo, is what I want.>> Because wisdom is what Solomon wanted, Apo God was happy/excited, and he Apo God gave [it]. And Ruler Solomon now became the wisest person here and Apo God made him also rich.1. Hinyay kahagiliyan nan Poon David?2. Hinyay dinyag nan Apo Dioh kanan Poon Solomon?

In Jerusalem, Solomon built the Temple for which his father David had planned and gathered materials. Instead of the Tent of Meeting, people now worshiped God and offered sacrifices to Him in the Temple. God came and was present in the Temple, and He lived there with His people.Hiyay Poon Solomon, impaideng nay Templo a Panggalangan kanan Apo Dioh ha banwan Jerusalem. Hinombong nay palano a dinyag nan bapa na a hiyay Poon David. Haanin, aliwaynan Toldan impadyag nan Moises ye gawien lan panggalangan boy pangihagpaan nin idigalo la kanan Apo Dioh, no aliwan hiyay Templo. Anti yay Apo Dioh ha Templo, kalamo nin tatao minamangaamot.BT: Ruler Solomon, he caused-to-stand the Templo which is the Honoring/Worshipping-place to Apo God in the city of Jerusalem. He followed the plan which was-made by his father who was Ruler David. Now, not the Tent which Moises caused-to-be-made is what they will-use to honor and set-down to give-gift to Apo God, but rather the Templo. Apo God is present in the Temple, companioning with the people everyday.1. Hinyay dyagen nan Solomon?2. Hinyay onan tao a nang-ihip a manyag nin Panggalangan kanan Apo Dioh?

But Solomon loved women from other countries. He disobeyed God by marrying many women, almost 1,000 of them! Many of these women came from foreign countries and brought their gods with them and worshiped them. When Solomon was old, he worshiped their gods.Noba hiyay Solomon, malabong ye babayi a ang-adoen na a ibat ha nakahinadi a lologal. Maigit malibo ye aahawa na. Ha in-ahawa nay malabong, ahe na hinombong ye bilin nan Apo Dioh. Hilay aahawa na, kinaget lay andiohen la a aliwan peteg a dioh. Ket yabayti met ye pangobayan nan Poon Solomon a manombong ya met ha andiohen lan aahawa na. Ket aliwan hohto yati ha pamilew nan Apo Dioh.BT - But Ruler Solomon, many are the women whom he is-loving who are from different places. Greater than one thousand are his wives. When he married many, he did not follow/obey the command of Apo God. These wives of his, they carried/brought their being-worshipped-as-god which are not true god. And this also is then basis of Ruler Solomon that he will-follow/obey also what is-being-worshipped-as-god by his wives. And not right is this in the sight of Apo God.1. Anoy ahawa nan Solomon?2. Taket ta nanombong yay Solomon ha diohdiohan?

God was angry with Solomon and, as a punishment for Solomon’s unfaithfulness, said He would divide the kingdom of Israel in two after Solomon’s death.Oli yatin dinyag nan Solomon, ket napoot yaynay Apo Dioh kana. Kaya-bay oli ha poot nan Apo Dioh kanan Solomon, hinabi na, <<No matey yaynay Solomon, ihiyay koynay panakopan Israel.>>BT - Because of this which Solomon did, Apo God became-angry to-him. So because of the anger of Apo God to Solomon, he said, <<If/when Solomon will-die, I will-divide now the having-jurisdiction-place of Israel.>>1. Hinyay tanam nan Apo Dioh kanan Poon Solomon?2. Hinyay dinyag nan Apo Dioh kanan Poon Solomon?

After Solomon died, his son, Rehoboam, became king. Rehoboam was a foolish man. All the people of Israel came together to confirm him as king. They also complained that Solomon had made them do a lot of hard work and pay a lot of taxes.Ha natey yayna met ye Poon Solomon, hiyay anak na a nagngalan Rehoboam ye kahagiliyan nan bapa na a manakop ana met kanlan Israelita. Naytitipon hilay Israelita, ta magdiklamo hila kanan bayon Poon Rehoboan, hinabi la, <<Mabyat ye panakop nan bapa mo boy mablin  tobat ye paningil na nin bowih kammi. Noba no makokompang ye panakop mo, pahakop kayi kammo.>> BT - When Ruler Solomon died, his child who was-named Rehoboam is the replacement of his father who will-have-jurisdiction to the Israelites. The Israelites gathered-together, for they complained to the new Ruler Rehoboam, they-said, <<Heavy is the having-jurisdiction of your father and very expensive is his collecting of tax to-us(excl). But if will-be-lightened-to us(excl) in your having-jurisdiction, we(excl) will-submit to-you.>>1. Hinyay diklamo lan Israelita kanan Poon Rehoboam?

Rehoboam answered foolishly and told them, “You thought my father Solomon made you work hard, but I will make you work harder than he did, and I will punish you worse than he did.”Noba hiyay Rehoboam, motaw ya, ta nakibat ya kanlan Israelita, <<Ahe malyadin komompang. Ta no mabyat ye panakop nan bapa ko kanyo, lalalo anan ingat mabyat ye panakop ko.>>BT - But Ruler Rehoboam, he is a fool, for he answered the Israelites, <<Not possible to be-lightened. For if heavy is the having-jurisdiction of my father to-you(PL), even more now heavy is my having-jurisdiction.>>1. Hinyay pakibat nan Poon Rehoboam kanla?

Ten of the tribes of Israel rebelled against Rehoboam. Only two tribes remained faithful to him. These two tribes were called the kingdom of Judah.Oli ha kalok-an nin panakop nan Poon Rehoboam, mapo kanlan lalahi nin Israel ye nangihyay kana. Lowan bengat ye napatla a ampahakop kana. Hilati ye angkahabtan, <<Panakopan Juda.>>BT - Because of the evil of the having jurisdiction of Ruler Rehoboam, ten clans of Israel were the ones who separated from-him, they separated from-him. And two only clans were left who are-under-jurisdiction of him. Now, these are-being-called <<Jurisdiction-place of Juda.>>1. Taket ta linomaban hilay 10 a lalahin Israelita?2. Hinyay nalyadi ha panakop nan Poon Rehoboam?

The other ten tribes that rebelled against Rehoboam made a man named Jeroboam their king. They were called the kingdom of Israel.Hilay 10 a lalahin nangihyay kanan Poon Rehoboam, namili hilan pagpoon la. Ket hiyay Jeroboam ye napili la. Hilatin 10 a lalahi ye angkahabtan, <<Panakopan nin Israel.>>BT - The 10 clans of people who separated from Ruler Rehoboam, they chose their being-ruler. And Jeroboam is the one they chose. These 10 clans are the ones being-called <<Jurisdiction-place of Israel.>>1. Hinyay panabet kanlan 10 a lalahin tao a linomaban kanan Poon Rehoboam?

Jeroboam rebelled against God and caused the people to sin. He built two idols for his people to worship instead of worshiping God at the Temple in the kingdom of Judah.Hiyay Jeroboam a poon ha Panakopan Israel, anhag-elen na hilay malabay makew ha Panakopan Juda omon hila manggalang ha Panggalangan kanan Apo Dioh ihtew. Kaya-bay ha hadili nan Panakopan a Israel, nanyag yan loway andiohen ta omen na hila igaygay a manggalang ha dinyag nan aliwan peteg a dioh. Ha wanabay a dinyag na, mabyat ye kahalanan na boy hilay Israelita.BT - Jeroboam who is the ruler of the Jurisdiction-place Israel, he is-stopping/preventing those who want to go to the Jurisdiction-place of Juda in order that they will-honor/worship at the Honoring-place to Apo God there. So in his own Jurisdiction-place of Israel, he made two being-worshipped-as-god in order that he will-persuade them to honor/worship to the not true god he made. In like-that which he did, heavy is his sin and the Israelites.1. Way-omen ye pamoon nan Poon Jeroboam?2. Taket ta ahe hila nakew a maghimba ye tatao?

The kingdoms of Judah and Israel became enemies and often fought against each other.Ket ha wanabay, napaykapoot ye Israel boy Juda. Ket yabay-in yaynay pinangobayan nin maheheg a paylalaban la.BT - And in like-that, Israel and Juda became-angry-at-each-other. And this is the basis of their frequent fighting-each-other.1. Taket ta napaylaban hilay Israel boy Juda?

In the kingdom of Israel, all the kings were evil. Many of these kings were killed by other Israelites who wanted to become king in their place.Hiyay balang poon a nanakop ha Israel, ket mangaloke hila. Malabong kanlan hilatin popoon ye pinatey nin kapadiho lan Israelita. Ket hilatin Israelitan namatey kanla, labay lan bengat a hilabay ye manakop.BT - Each of the rulers who took-jurisdiction of Israel, they were evil. Many are these rulers who were-killed by their fellow Israelites. And these Israelites who killed them, they just wanted that they will-have-jurisdiction.1. Way-omen hilatin popoon ha pandogi nin pamoon la?2. Way-omen hilatin popoon ha kalinghoyotan nin pamoon la?3. Hinyay namatey kanlan popoon?

All of the kings of Israel and most of the people worshiped idols which often included adultery and sometimes even child sacrifice.Hilay kaganaan a popoon a nanakop ha Israel boy kalabongan kanlan Israelita ket nanggalang hila ha andiohen a aliwan peteg a dioh. Aliwan bengat yatew, ampakilaki boy ampakibabayi hila po boy an-idigalo la po ye aanak la bilang hagpa ha andiohen la.BT - All the rulers who took-jurisdiction of Israel and many of the Israelites they honored what is-being-worshipped-as-god which are not true gods. Not just that, they committed-adultery-with-male and committed-adultery-with-female still and they still are-giving-as-gift their children as set-down to what they are-worshipping-as-god.1. Hilay ampaghimba kanan Apo Dioh, way-ihtew hila ampakew a ampaghimba?

The kings of Judah were descendants of David. Some of these kings were good men who ruled justly and worshiped God. But most of Judah’s kings were evil, corrupt, and idol-worshipers. Some of the kings even sacrificed their children to false gods. The people of Judah also rebelled against God and worshiped other gods.Hilay nag-ilyadin poon ha Juda, nang-ibat hila ha lahi nan Poon David. Ket hilay kanayon, magaling hilan poon boy ampanombong hila ha kalabayan nan Apo Dioh. Noba hilay kalabongan met, mangaloke hila boy ampanggalang hila ha andiohen a aliwan peteg a dioh. Hilay nangaano kanla, an-ihagpay lay aanak la bilang digalo ha andiohen la. Ahe hilayna ampanombong kanan Apo Dioh, no aliwan panohombong layna ha aliwan peteg a dioh.BT - Those who became ruler in Juda, they came-from the clan/descent of David. Some, they are skilled at ruling and they are following the will/desire of Apo God. But most of them, they are evil and they are-honoring/worshipping the being-worshipped-as-god which are not true god. Some of them, they are-setting-down their children as gift to those they are-worshipping-as-god. The are- not -following/obeying Apo God, but rather they are-following/obeying not true gods.

Throughout the history of the Israelites, God sent them prophets. The prophets heard messages from God and then told the people God’s messages.Paibat ha onan panaon, an-itobol nan Apo Dioh ye popropita na a makew kanlan Israelita. Ta hilabay anay mangibalita kanlan tatao nin bibilin nan Apo Dioh.BT - From the first time, Apo God is-sending his prophets to go to the Israelites. For they now will the ones to news to the people the commands of Apo God.1. Way-omen naghabi yay Apo Dioh kanlan tatao?

Elijah was a prophet when Ahab was king over Israel. Ahab was an evil man who encouraged people to worship a false god named Baal. Elijah said to Ahab, “There will be no rain or dew in Israel until I say so.”Hatew ha panaon nan Poon Acab, hiyay Elias ye podopita ha Israel. Hiyay Poon Acab, inadalan na hilay tataon manggalang kanan Baal a aliwan peteg a Dioh. Ket hinabi nan Elias kana, a wana, “Tandah yan mangodan ha kaganaan a lologal nin Israel agya dalaidi bengat anggan ahe ko po habiyen a mangodan oman.” Kaya-bay napoot yan tobat ye Poon Acab.BT - In time-past in the time of Ruler Acab, Elias is the prophet in Israel. Ruler Acab, he taught the people to honor/worship Baal who is a not true God. And Elias spoke to-him, he-said, "[It] will not rain in all the places of Israel even only sprinkle while I have not yet said that [it] will-rain again." So Ruler Acab was very angry.1. Hinyay inadalan Poon Acab kanlan tatao?2. Hinyay impahabi nan Apo Dioh kanan Poon Acab makaoli kanan Elias?3. Taket ta napoot yay Poon Acab?

Then God told Elijah to hide in the wilderness near a stream. Every morning and every evening, birds would bring him bread and meat. Ahab and his army looked for Elijah, but they could not find him. The drought was so severe that the stream eventually dried up.Hilay tatao nan Poon Acab, antapolen la yay Elias. Noba ahe la ya nakitan ta pinatayo na yan Apo Dioh ha maghay logal a main hobol a ampinoman. Ket tepe mahanib, main oowak a ampangilakew kana nin tinapay boy kena. Noba oli ta homain anan odan, ket namal-an yaynay hobol a ampinoman na.BT - The people of Ruler Acab, they are-looking-for Elias. But they did not find him for Apo God caused- him -to-be-hidden in a place which has a spring which is-drinking-from. And each morning, there are crows which are-bringing to-hiim bread and meat. But because there is no rain, became-dry already the spring he is-drinking-from.1. Taket ta hilay hondaloh nan Poon Acab, ahe la ya nakitan ye Elias?2. Way-omen nangan boy ninom yay Elias?3. Hinyay nalyadi ha hobol ihtew?

So Elijah went to a neighboring country. A widow and her son had almost run out of food because of the famine. But they took care of Elijah, and God provided so that neither their flour jar nor their bottle of oil ever ran out. They had food through the whole famine. Elijah stayed there a long time.Ket hiyay Apo Dioh, pinalakew na yay Elias ha maghan nahyon a maahaley ha Israel. Main met bawo ihtewbay. Ket main yan maghay anak a laki. Boy madanon anan maoboh ye pamangan la, oli ha nilalo anan kaamotan. Noba agya wanabay man, pinaona laya po a pinakan ye Elias. Ket ahe la angkaobohoboh ye tapok la, boy ahe la angkaobohoboh ye taba a panonggit, ta hiyay Apo Dioh ye namyay nin pamangan la anggan anti ya po ye Elias ihtewbay.BT - And Apo God, he caused-to-go Elias to a nation which is close to Israel. There also is a widow there. And she has a male child. And soon now will-be-empty/consumed their food, because became-especially hot. But even-though like-that, they still caused-to-go-first to eat Elias. And they are- not -consuming their flour, and they are- not -consuming the fat which ??, for Apo God is the one who gave their food while Elias is still present there.1. Hinyay dinyag nan bawo kanan Elias?2. Taket ta ahe maoboh ye pamangan la?

After three years, God told Elijah to return to Israel and speak with Ahab because He was going to send rain again. When Ahab saw Elijah he said, “There you are, you troublemaker!” Elijah said, “You are the troublemaker! You have abandoned the true God and worshiped Baal. Bring all of Israel to Mount Carmel.”Pangalabah nin tatlon taon boy kagitna, hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanan Elias, a wana, “Mag-odong kayna ha Israel, ta habiyen mo kanan Poon Acab a paodanen ko yan oman.” Noba ha nakit na yay Elias a ampaghabi, hinabi na met kanan Elias, a wana, “Ah! Anti kan bengat manayti ihen a mapanggolo ha Israel!” Nakibat yay Elias, a wana, “Hikay mapanggolo ha Israel! Ta naliwaan moy peteg a Dioh. Ket haanin, ampanggalang kayna kanan Baal a aliwan peteg a dioh. Kaya-bay haanin, itobol mo hilay tatao a makew ha matondol nan Carmelo.”1. Hinyay habiyen nan Apo Dioh kanan Poon Acab?2. Ha nakit na yan Poon Acab ye Elias, hinyay natanam na?3. Hinyay diklamo nan Elias kanan Poon Acab?

All the people of the kingdom of Israel, including the 450 prophets of Baal, came to Mount Carmel. Elijah said to the people, “How long will you keep changing your mind? If Yahweh is God, serve him! If Baal is God, serve him!”Kaya-bay nakew hilan kaganaan a tatao ihtew ha Mapantay nan Carmelo, lamo la hilay 450 a popodopeta nan Baal. Ket hinabi nan Elias kanlan Israelita, a wana, “Paholong nayi a paoman oman ye ihip yo a maghilbi kanan Apo Dioh a peteg a Dioh? Noba no hiyay Baal ye peteg a Dioh, ket hiyabay anan bengat ye paghilbiyan yo!”1. Hinyay nakew ha Mapantay nan Carmelo?3. Hinyay labay nan matandaan Elias kanlan Israelita?

Then he said to the prophets of Baal, “Kill a bull and prepare a sacrifice, but do not light the fire. I will do the same. The God who answers with fire is the real God.” So the priests of Baal prepared a sacrifice but did not light the fire.Pangayadi, hinabi nan podopeta Elias kanlan popodopeta nan Baal, a wana, “No hiyay Baal ye peteg a Dioh, mangwa kawo man awod nin hinapo a kena a ihagpa yo kana ta olamen yo. Noba adi yo anggawien a pamadlag ye apoy ta hiyay Baal a dioh yo ye mangaolam. Ta agya hiko met, wanabay met ateed ye dapaten ko papainghan.” Ket dinapat lan peteg nin podopeta nan Baal ye hinabi nan podopeta Elias.1. Hinyay impadyag nan podopeta Elias kanlan popodopeta nan Baal?2. Hinyay dinyag lan popodopeta nan Baal?

Then they prayed to Baal, “Hear us, O Baal!” All day long they prayed and shouted and even cut themselves with knives, but Baal did not answer.Ket nakigwang hila, a wanla, “Dioh min Baal, leng-en mo kayi.” Nikahilem hilan ampakigwang a ampangha boy an-iwaen la po ye lalaman la noba homain yan pakibat ye Baal.1. Hinyay labay la kanan Baal?2. Hinyay dinyag lan popodopeta nan Baal?3. Hinyay dinyag nan Baal?

At the end of the day, Elijah prepared a sacrifice to God. Then he had twelve huge pots of water poured on top of the sacrifice until the meat, the wood, and even the ground around the altar was completely wet.Ket ha mahilem ana, hiyay Elias met ye mangihagpa nin baka kanan Apo Dioh a anggalangen na. Ket hiyay dinapat na, pinabohbohan na po nin labinlowan halaw a lanom ye hagpa na. Ket naheb anan lanom ye pandongot boy palibot nin hagpa.1. Hinyay dinyag nan Elias?2. Taket ta pinabohbohan na nin lanom ye hagpa na?

Then Elijah prayed, “O LORD, God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, show us today that You are the God of Israel and that I am Your servant. Answer me so that these people will know that You are God.”Pangayadi nan impabohbohan, ket nakigwang ya, a wana, “Apo a Dioh nan Abraham, Isaac boy Hacob, ipakit mo haanin a hika ye peteg a Dioh nin Israel boy hika ye Dioh ko a ampaghilbi kamo. Ket leng-en mo Apo ye pamakigwang ko kamo ta omen la matandaan nin tatao a hika ye peteg a Dioh.”1. Taket ta hinabi nan Elias a hiyay Apo Dioh ye Dioh nan Abraham, Isaac, boy Hacob?2. Taket ta labay nan Elias a leng-en nan Apo Dioh ye pamakigwang na?

Immediately, fire fell from the sky and burned up the meat, the wood, the rocks, and even the wet ground around the altar. When the people saw this, they fell on the ground and said, “The LORD is God! The LORD is God!”Kapipikhaan, nagampag ye apoy a ibat ha langit a nangolam nin baka, kayo boy dadapah angga ha kinomlang ye lota ha palibot nin pangihagpaan. Ket ha nakit lan tatao yatin nalyadi, nanlimokod hila boy hinabi la, a wanla, “Hika Apo Dioh ye peteg a Dioh! Hika Apo Dioh ye peteg a Dioh!”1. Hinyay nalyadi ha hagpa na boy palibot?2. Hinyay dinyag lan tatao?3. Hinyay hinabi la?

Then Elijah said, “Do not let any of the prophets of Baal escape!” So the people captured the prophets of Baal. Then Elijah took them away and killed them.Ket hinabi nan Elias kanlan tatao, a wana, “Dakepen yo hila! Adi yo hila ampaolayen a makatakah ye poporopeta nan Baal!” Kaya-bay, dinakep la hila boy pinatey.1. Hinyay bilin nan Elias kanlan tatao?2. Hinyay dinyag nan Elias kanlan popodopeta nan Baal?

Then Elijah said to King Ahab, “Return immediately to the city, for the rain is coming.” Soon the sky grew black, and a large rain storm came. God had ended the drought and proved that He is the only God.Ket hinabi na met nin Elias kanan Poon Acab, a wana, “Tampol kaynan mag-odong ha mayadet a banwa ta madanon yaynay malgeh/makhaw a odan.” Ahe nagboyot, nangodan yanan peteg nin makhaw/malgeh boy makhaw a agoot. Ha pangayadi nin makhaw a agoot, ket natandaan laynay Dioh a kaptegan oli kananyatin nalyadi.1. Hinyay nalyadi ha ahe naboyot?2. Hinyay pinaptegan nan Apo Dioh?

After Elijah, God chose Elisha to be His prophet. God did many miracles through Elisha. One time, Naaman, an enemy commander, found out he had a horrible skin disease called leprosy. He had heard of Elisha so he went and asked Elisha to be healed. Elisha told him to dip himself seven times in the Jordan River.Ha nanik yay Elias ha langit, ket hiyay Eliseo met ye hinomoblat a bilang podopeta. Boy malabong a okdo ye dinyag nan Apo Dioh a kapagtakaan makaoli kanan Eliseo. Hiyay maghan kapagtakaan a dinyag nan Apo Dioh, ket hiyay pamaitaah nan Eliso kanan Naaman a kapitan nin tataon kalaban ha logal la. Main yan mabyat a hakit ha loti ye Naaman, ket nabalitaan nay tongkol kanan Eliseo. Kaya-bay pinakihabi na kanan Eliseo, a wana, “No malyadi dayi, paitaahen mo ko.” Ket ha wanabay, intobol na yan Eliseo ye Naaman a makew donglep nin piton okdo ha Kabatowan nin Jordan.1. Hinyay kahagili nan Elias?2. Hinyay maghay kapagtakaan a dinyag nan Apo Dioh makaoli kanan Eliseo?3. Hinyay labay nan Naaman?4. Hinyay bilin nan Eliseo kanan Naaman?

At first Naaman was angry and would not do it. But later he changed his mind and dipped himself seven times in the Jordan River. When he came up the last time, his skin was completely healed! God had healed him.Ha pamakange nan Naaman ye hinabi nan Eliseo, napoot ya boy agya nanopad. Noba ha hoyot a panaon, ket dinonglep ya met ateed nin piton okdo. Ket ha ikapiton pangomondolaw nan Naaman, ket homain yaynan hakit ha loti, ta pinaitaah na yaynan Apo Dioh.1. Ha nange nan Naaman ye bilin nan Eliseo, hinyay natanam na?2. Ha kalinghoyotan, hinyay dinyag nan Naaman?3. Hinyay dinyag nan Apo Dioh kanan Naaman?

There were many other prophets. They all told the people to stop worshiping idols and to start showing justice and mercy. The prophets warned the people that if they did not turn from their sins and start living obedient lives, then God’s judgment would come, and He would punish them.Hilay popropeta, lanang lan an-itanda kanlan tatao, a wanla, “Maghehe kawo ha kakahalanan yo boy itgen yoynay panggalang yon kanayon a andiohen. Ta no ahe kawo manopad ha bibilin nin Apo Dioh, homain hapo a padohaan na kawo.”1. Hinyay bilin nan Apo Dioh kanlan Israelita?2. Hinyay diyagen nan Apo Dioh kanlan Israelita no ahe hila manopad ha bibilin na?

Most of the time, the people did not listen. They often mistreated the prophets and sometimes even killed them. Once, the prophet Jeremiah was put into a dry well and left there to die. He sank down into the mud that was in the bottom of the well, but then the king had mercy on him and pulled him out before he died.Noba, adi lan teed an-ibabano ye bibilin a an-itanda lan popodopeta na. No minghan, ampahakitan la hila boy ampateyen la hila a omon kanan propita Jeremias a pinatey la. Ta in-ampag la ya ha namal-an a libon boy linakwanan la ya ta omon ya matey ihtewbay. Noba nangingalo yay poon kana. Kaya-bay nakew yan nangwa kana ta omen ya ahe matey.1. Hinyay andyagen lan Israelita kanlan popodopeta nan Apo Dioh?2. Hinyay dinyag la kanan Jeremias?3. Hinyay dinyag nan poon kanan Jeremias?

Even though the prophets were hated, they continued to speak for God. They warned people that they would be destroyed if they did not repent. They also reminded people of the promise that God’s Messiah would come.Hilay popropeta, agya naidapan hila, ket imbabala lan teed ye impatanda nan Apo Dioh kanla. Imbabala la, a wanla, “No homain kawon paghehe ha kakahalanan yo, madama kawo.” Imbalita la met, a wanla, “Yo! Ihipen yoy impangako nan Apo Dioh a itobol na yay Mesias a Mangiligtah kantawo.”1. Hinyay impaihip lan popodopeta kanlan Israelita tongkol ha kakahalanan la?2. Hinyay impaihip lan popodopeta kanlan Israelita tongkol ha Mangiligtah?

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: 1 Kings 16-18; 2 Kings 5; Jeremiah 38
chapters.title: ** 19. Hilay popodopeta

frames.text: The nations of Israel and Judah both sinned against God. They broke the Covenant that God made with them at Mount Sinai. God sent His prophets to warn them to repent and worship Him again, but they refused to listen.Hilay tataon nahyon Israel boy Juda, ahe hila ampanopad ha bibilin nan Apo Dioh a in-ibyay na ihtew ha Mapantay nin Sinai. Kaya-bay, nagkahalanan hila kanan Apo Dioh. Oli kananyatin dinyag la, nangitobol yayna man ye Apo Dioh nin popropeta na a mangibabala kanla, noba aghilan teed tinomopad.1. Why did God say that Israel and Judah had sinned against him?2. Why did God send prophets to the Israelites?3. What did the Israelites do when God sent prophets to them?

So God punished both nations by allowing them to be destroyed. Israel was destroyed by the Assyrian Empire, a powerful, cruel nation. The Assyrians killed many Israelites, took away everything of value, and burned much of the country.Ket hilay taga Assiria, hinambot la hilay Israelita. Homain hilan lonoh ye taga Asiria boy malabong ye pinatey la a taga Israel haka la inolam ye kaganaan a hahakop la.Hinambot hilan hohondalon nin nahyon Asiria boy malabong a tataon pinatey la boy inolam lay babanwa ha Israel. Hilay taga nahyon Asiria, dinama lay kaganaan a hakop nin Israel. Boy kingwa lan kaganaan a mangaalaga a babandi la.1. How did God punish the Israelites?2. What did the Assyrians do to the Israelites?

The Assyrians gathered all the leaders, the rich people, and the people with skills and took them to Assyria. Only the very poor Israelites who had not been killed remained in Israel.Ket hilay popoon lan Israelita, hilay mangabatnang boy hilay mangagagaling manyag nin bibilding ha banwa la, ket inawoyon la hilan inlakew ha logal lan taga Asiria.Pangayadi, tinapol la hila popoon, mangabatnang, boy magaling a tatao. Ket inawoyon la hilan balol a palakew ha Asiria. Ket hilay maidap anan bengat ye nabantak ha Israel. 1. Who did the Assyrians take back to Assyria?2. Why do you think they did that?3. Who were left in Israel?

Then the Assyrians brought foreigners to live in Israel. The foreigners rebuilt the destroyed cities and married the Israelites who were left there. Their descendants were called Samaritans.Hilay taga Asiria, nangipalakew hilan kanayon a tataon ibat ha kanayon a lologal a makew ha Israel, ta ipaideng la yan oman ye naolam a panakopan ta ihtewbay hilayna komonin boy nakaahawa po nin Israelita ye kanayon kanla. Ket hilay aanak la, hinabtan la hilan “Samaritano”.Ket hilay taga-Asiria, inlamo la hila met ye dadayohan kanlan nabantak a Israelita. Haanin, hilay dadayohan, naki-ahawa hila kanlan nabantak a Israelita. Ket hilay aanak la, nahabtan hilan “Samaritano”. 1. Who did the Assyrians bring to live in Israel?2. What did the foreigners do in Israel?3. Who are the Samaritans?

The people in the kingdom of Judah saw how God had punished the kingdom of Israel for not believing and obeying Him. But they still worshiped idols and the gods of the Canaanites. God sent prophets to warn them, but they refused to listen.Hilay tatao ha Juda, nakitan lan kaganaan ye pamadoha nan Apo Dioh ihtew ha Israel, oli ha ahe la panombong kanan Apo Dioh. Noba nagpaholong hilan teed a nanggalang ha andiyohen lan Cananeo. Hiyay Apo Dioh, nangitobol yan popropita a namabala kanla, noba adi la yan teed imbabano.1. What had God done to Israel?2. Did Juda learn a lesson from what happened to Israel?3. What did the prophets tell those in Judah?

About 100 years after the Assyrians destroyed Israel, God sent Nebuchadnezzar, king of the Babylonians, to attack Judah. Babylon was a powerful empire. The king of Judah agreed to be Nebuchadnezzar’s servant and pay him lots of money every year.Ha nalabah ye 100 a taon paibat ha nadama ye nahyon Israel, hiyay Apo Dioh, intobol na yay Nabukadnezar a poon ha nahyon Babilonia, lamo na hilay  hohondaloh na, a mandawohong ha banwan Juda. Ket hinambot la hilay Israelita. Kaya-bay nag-ilyadi hilan iipoh nin taga Babilonia boy pabayaden la hila nin taon-taon nin mayadet/malake a pilak kanlan taga Babilonia.  1. Why did King Nebuchadnezzar attack Israel?2. Who won the battle?3. After the battle, what did the king of Judah decide to do?

But soon the people of Judah rebelled against the Babylonians. So, the Babylonians came back and attacked them. They captured the city of Jerusalem, destroyed the Temple, and took away all the treasures.Hilay Israelita, linabanan la hilay taga Babilonia. Kaya-bay, hilay Babilonia, kinobkob lay banwan Jerusalem, ta inagwat lay Himbaan boy kingwa lay kabandiyan. 1. What did the people of Judah do to the Babylonians?2. What did the Babylonians do to Judah?

To punish Judah’s king for rebelling, Nebuchadnezzar’s soldiers killed the king’s sons in front of him and then made him blind. After that, they took the king away to die in prison in Babylon.Hiyay poon ha nahyon Israel, nilomaban ya kanlan hohondaloh nan Nabukadnezar. Kaya-bay, pinatey la yay anak na ha adapan na haka la met tinleh ye mata nan poon. Pangayadi impaatel la ya ha Babilonia ta omon ya maibalol anggan angkabi-ay ya.1. How did Nebuchadnezzar's soldiers punish the king of Judah?2. Who was put in prison in Babylon?

Nebuchadnezzar and his army took all the people of Judah to Babylon, leaving only the poorest people behind to plant the fields. This is called the Exile.Hiyay Nabukadnesar boy hohondaloh na, in-alih la hilay tatao ha Juda pweda po kanlan mangaidap a mānanem ha talon la. Ket yatin logal, angkahabtan, “Pāngalihan.”   1. What did King Nebuchadnezzar do with the rich people of Judah?2. What did King Nebuchadnezzar do with the poor people of Judah?

Even though the Exile was punishment for their sin, God did not forget His people or His promises. God watched over His people and spoke to them through His prophets. He promised that, after seventy years, they would return to the Promised Land again.Ha anti hilay kapiyol ha logal a nangitaponan pagkabihag la, ket agna hila pinaolayan nin Apo Dioh. Hiyay Apo Dioh, kinatongtong na hila makaoli kanlan propita a intobol na. Hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanla, a wana, “Pangayadi nin 70 a taon, iodong katawon oman ha Juda."   1. How did God show that he had not forgotten his people, those from Juda?2. What did he promise the people of Judah?

About seventy years later, Cyrus, the king of the Persians, defeated Babylon. The Persians were a strong but merciful people. The Israelites were now called Jews and most of them had lived their whole lives in Babylon. Only a few very old Jews even remembered the land of Judah.Hilay Israelita, kinomonin hila ha Babilonia ha loob nin 70 a taon. Ket  malabong anay nangalyadi boy nanga-oman. Haanin, hiyay Ciro a Poon ha Persia, nanambot ya kanlan Babilonia. Kaya-bay nahakop na hilay Israelita a anti ha nahyon Persia. Ket hilay Israelita, anhabtan la hilaynan Jujudio. Ket ha kaboyotan lan kinomonin a mataang ha logal la ha Juda, makandi bengat ye maihipan ye Juda. 1. What happened to the Babylonians?2. Why did only a few Jews remember their place of Judah?

Shortly after Cyrus came to power, he did something that had never been done before in history. He gave an order that any Jew who wanted to return to Judah could go. He even gave them money to rebuild the Temple! After seventy years in exile, a small group of Jews returned to Jerusalem.Ha ahe naboyot a ampanakop ye Poon Ciro, impabalita nay bilin, a wana, “Hikawon Jujudio, malyadi kawoynan moli ha Juda, ta ipaideng yon oman ye naagwat a Himbaan.” Ket nag-odong ye maghay pangkat lan Jujudio ha Jerusalem.1. What did King Cyrus tell the Jews to do?2. Why do you think this king sent these slaves of his back to their former place to rebuild their temple?

When they arrived, they rebuilt the Temple and the wall around the city of Jerusalem. Although they were still ruled by other people, they lived in the Promised Land again and worshiped at the Temple.Ha anti hilayna ha Jerusalem, impaideng lan oman ye Himbaan boy impaideng la met ye alad nin banwan Jerusalem. Agya po anti hila ha hakop nin dadayohan. Ket malyadi hilayna man a komonin ha lota a impangako nan Apo Dioh kanla boy anlomoob hilayna ha Himbaan a manggalang kanan Apo Dioh. 1. What did these Jews do when they arrived in Jerusalem?2. Who had jurisdiction over Jerusalem at this time?

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: 2 Kings 17; 24-25; 2 Chronicles 36; Ezra 1-10; Nehemiah 1-13
chapters.title: ** 20. The Exile and Return

frames.text: The first promise of the coming Messiah came to Adam and Eve. God promised that a descendant of Eve would be born who would crush the snake’s head. The snake who deceived Eve is Satan. The promise means the coming Messiah would defeat Satan completely.Noon pa mang una, plano na ng Diyos na magpadala ng isang Tagapagligtas sa mga tao. Noong nagkasala sina Adan at Eba, ipinangako na ito ng Diyos. Sinabi niya sa ahas, “Ang anak ng babae ang dudurog sa ulo mo. Ikaw naman ang kakagat sa sakong niya.” Ang ahas na nanlinlang kay Eba ay si Satanas. Ang ibig sabihin ng Diyos, mayroong ipapanganak ang siyang tatalo kay Satanas.Ha hatew po, hiyay Apo Dioh, inihip nayna a mangitobol yan mangiligtah nin tatao. Ha nagkahalanan yay Adan boy Eba, yati ye impangako nan Apo Dioh kanla, hinabi na a, <Maabot lano ye panaon, ket magha kanlan lalahi yo ye mamitpit nin o nan bikat>. Hiyay labay habiyen nin bikat ket hiyay Satanas a nanalingo kanan Eba ha hatew.

God promised Abraham that through him all people groups of the world would be blessed. This blessing was the coming Messiah who would one day provide the way of salvation for all people groups.Ipinangako din ng Diyos kay Abraham na dahil sa kanya ay makakatanggap ng pagpapala ang mga lahat ng tao. Ang pagpapalang ito ay ang pagdating ng Tagapagligtas.Hiyay Apo Dioh, impangako na met kanan Abraham, a wana, <<Makaoli kamo, inged ko hilay kaganaan a nanahyon. Yatin kangedan ket hiyay panlomateng nin Mangiligtah.>>

God promised Moses that He would raise up another prophet like Moses. This was another reference to the coming Messiah.Ipinangako naman ng Diyos kay Moises na mayroong darating na isang propetang katulad niya. Ito ay isa ring pangako ng Diyos tungkol sa Tagapagligtas.Hiyay Apo Dioh, impangako na met kanan Moises a mangitobol yan maghan propita a omon kana. Magha po yati kanlan impangako nan Apo Dioh a tongkol kanan Mangiligtah.

God promised David that the Messiah would be one of David’s own descendants.Ipinangako ng Diyos kay David na isa sa mga magiging kaapu-apuhan niya ang Tagapagligtas.Ha hatew, impangako na met Apo Dioh kanan Poon David, a magha kanlan kaapo-apowan na ye Mangiligtah, a wana, <<Hiyay impangako ko kanan Adan boy Eba, Abraham boy Moises, ket hiya met ateed kammo, ta mangibat ya lano ha lalahi mo ye Mangiligtah.>>

Through the prophet Jeremiah, God promised that He would make a New Covenant, but not like God’s Covenant with Israel. In the New Covenant, God would write His law on the people’s hearts, the people would know God, they would be His people, and God would forgive their sins. The Messiah would start the New Covenant.Sa pamamagitan ni Propeta Jeremias, ipinangako ng Diyos na gagawa siya ng isang Bagong Kasunduan. Iba ito sa kasunduan niya sa mga taga-Israel. Sa Bagong Kasunduan, isusulat ng Diyos sa puso ng mga tao ang mga gusto niyang gawin nila. Ang mga taong ito na magpapasyang kilalanin ang Diyos ang siyang magiging bayan ng Diyos. Patatawarin ng Diyos ang mga kasalanan nila. Sa darating na Tagapagligtas magsisimula ang Bagong Kasunduan.Ha hatew, hinabi nan Apo Dioh kanan Jeremias, a wana, <<Habiyen mo kanlan tatao a, <Ha hatew, hiyay bibilin ket inholat ko ya ha dadapah. Noba haanin, manyag akon bayon bilin boy iholat koyna ha poho la. Ket hilay mamigbig kangko ye diyagen kon pagtao ko. Ket patawaden ko hila ha kakahalanan la.>> Mandog yati ha panlomateng nin Mangiligtah.

The coming Messiah would be a prophet, a priest, and a king. A prophet is a person who hears the words of God and then proclaims God’s words to the people. The coming Messiah would be the perfect prophet.Sinabi din ng mga propeta na ang Tagapagligtas ay magiging propeta, pari at hari. Ang propeta ay ang mga taong nakikinig sa sinasabi ng Diyos at sinasabi naman nila ito sa mga tao. Ganito din ang gagawin ng darating na Tagapagligtas.Hinabi la po nin popropita a hiyay Mesias, ket magha yan <<propita, padi, boy poon.>> Hiyay propita, magha yan taon mangiabot kanlan tatao nin nange na kanan Apo Dioh. Wanabay met lano ye diyagen nan lomateng a Mangiligtah.

A priest is someone who makes sacrifices to God on behalf of the people to take away their sins. Priests also pray to God for the people. The coming Messiah would be the perfect high priest who would offer himself as a perfect sacrifice to God.Ang paring-Judio naman ang naghahandog para patawarin ng Diyos ang mga tao. Ipinapanalangin din nila ang mga tao. Kaya, ihahandog din ng Tagapagligtas ang sarili niya para patawarin ng Diyos ang lahat ng tao.Hiyay padi nin Jujudio met ye ampangihagpa kanan Apo Dioh ta omen mapatawad ye kakahalanan nin tatao boy hiya met ateed ye mangipakigwang kanla. Hiyay Mangiligtah, hadili nan laman ye ihagpa na ta omen mapatawad ye kakahalanan nin tatao.

A king is someone who rules over a kingdom and judges the people. The coming Messiah would be the perfect king who would sit on the throne of his ancestor David, who would reign over the whole world forever, and who would judge honestly and make the right decision every time.Ang mga hari naman ang namumuno sa mga kaharian at sila din ang humahatol sa mga tao kung tama o mali ang ginawa nila. Ganito din ang gagawin ng darating na Tagapagligtas. Siya ang magpapatuloy sa paghahari ni Haring David. Maghahari siya sa buong mundo. Hahatulan din niya ang mga ginagawa ng mga tao. Siya ay makatarungan at tama ang ginagawa niyang mga desisyon.Hiyay poon, hiya met ye ampanakop boy ampanohga kanlan tatao ha panakopan na. Hiyay Mangiligtah, genap yan poon, ket mikno ya lano ha pamiknoan nan Poon David a kaapoapowan na. Mamoon yan homain anggaan ha babe lota. Hiya met ateed ye manohga kanlan tatao ihti ha babe lota. Ket matoynong ye panohga na.

The prophets predicted the birth of the coming Messiah. Malachi foretold that a great prophet would come before the Messiah came. Isaiah prophesied that the Messiah would be born from a virgin. Micah said that he would be born in the town of Bethlehem.Sinabi ng mga propeta ang maraming bagay na mangyayari sa buhay ng darating na Tagapagligtas. Sinabi ni Malakias na may isang makapangyarihang propeta na mauuna sa Tagapagligtas. Sinabi naman ni Isaias na ipapanganak ng isang birhen ang Tagapagligtas. Si Mikas naman ang nagsabi na sa Betlehem ipapanganak ang Tagapagligtas.Hilay popropita, malabong a babagay ye inhola la a mangalyadi ha bi-ay nan Mangiligtah. Hinabi nan Malakias, a wana, "Lano ha lomateng ye Mangiligtah, mona ya po a lomateng ye makapalyadiyan a propita. Hiyay Isaias, hinabi na met, a wana, "Ianak ya lanon maghay balatang ye Mangiligtah." Hiyay Mikas, inhola na met, a wana, "Maianak ya lanoy Mangiligtah ha banwan Betlehem."

The prophets also prophesied about the Messiah’s ministry. Isaiah said he would live in Galilee, comfort the broken-hearted, proclaim freedom to captives, and release to prisoners. He also predicted that the Messiah would heal sick people, including those who could not hear, see, speak, or walk.Sinabi din ni Isaias na sa Galilea titira ang Tagapagligtas. Aaliwin nila ang mga nasasaktan. Palalayain niya ang mga binihag at pakakawalan niya ang mga bilanggo. Sinabi din niyang pagagalingin ng Tagapagligtas ang mga maysakit, pati ang mga hindi makarinig, hindi makakita, hindi makapagsalita o hindi makalakad.Inhola la po nin popropita no way-omen ye pagbi-ay nan Mangiligtah. Hiyay Isaias, inhola na a, "Komonin ya lanoy Mangiligtah ha Galilea. Ket liwaliwaen na hila angkalele, palihwayen na hilay naipoh boy hilay nakapidiho. Hinabi na po a, "Paitaahen na hilay ampaghakit, omel, teek, kapkap boy lompo."

Isaiah prophesied that the Messiah would be hated without reason and rejected. The Psalms foretold the Messiah’s that people would gamble for his clothes and he would be betrayed by a friend. (Psalms are Jewish worship songs in the Scriptures.) Zechariah foretold that the friend would be paid thirty pieces of silver for betraying him.Sinabi din ni Isaias na magagalit ang ibang mga tao sa Tagapagligtas. Hindi sila maniniwala dito. Sinabi pa ng ibang mga propeta na magsusugal ang mga taong papatay sa Tagapagligtas. Sinabi pa nila na isa sa mga kaibigan niya ang magtataksil sa kanya. Si Zacarias ang nagsabi na ang bayad sa pagtataksil na ito ay 30 salaping pilak.Noba hinabi na met propita Isaias a kapootan la ya lano boy ahe la ya balayen a hiyabay ye Mangiligtah. Hilay kanayon a popropita, hinabi la met a, "Mayhohogal hilay tataon mamatey kana. Hinabi la po a lipotan yan maghay gayyem na. Hiyay Zakarias, inhola na met, a wana, "Main lanon mangipaloke kana ha alaga nin 30 a pilak."

The prophets also told about how the Messiah would die. Isaiah prophesied that the Messiah would be spit on, mocked, and beaten. Then he would be pierced and hung on a tree where he would die.Sinabi na din ng mga propeta kung paano mamamatay ang Tagapagligtas. Sinabi na Isaias na duduraan siya, pagtatawanan at bubugbugin. Pagkatapos, siya ay sasaksakin ng sibat habang nakapako sa krus hanggang mamatay siya.Impatanda la po nin popropita no way-omen ye pagkamatey nan Mangiligtah. Inhola na po Isaias a "Lod-an la yay Mangiligtah, omihen boy bogbogen laya. Pangayadi, binghoen la ya legan nakapako ya ha kodoh anggan ha matey ya. Ket matey ya ha pietan nin lowan magkahalanan.

The Messiah would be perfect, having no sin. He would die to receive the punishment for other people’s sin. His punishment would bring peace between God and people. For this reason, it pleased God to crush the Messiah.Walang kasalanang nagawa ang Tagapagligtas. Ang parusang tatanggapin niya ay ang parusa para sa ibang tao. Pero dahil dito maaari nang magkasundo ulit ang Diyos at ang mga tao. Kaya tinanggap ng Diyos na maparusahan ang Tagapagligtas.Hiyay Mangiligtah, homain yan kahalanan. Noba mapadohaan yan teed oli ta hiyabay ye mananggap nin padoha ha kakahalanan nin tatao. Olin yati, main ana met katanaan ye tatao kanan Apo Dioh.

Not only would the Messiah die, but the prophets foretold that God would raise him from the dead. Through the Messiah’s death and resurrection, God would complete His plan of salvation and start the New Covenant.Hindi lang basta mamamatay ang Tagapagligtas. Pero ipinangako ng Diyos na mabubuhay siya ulit. At dahil sa kamatayan at muling pagkabuhay ng Tagapagligtas, matutupad na ang plano ng Diyos na iligtas ang mga tao mula sa kasalanan. Pwede na ulit silang gumawa ng isang Bagong Kasunduan.Hiyay kakahalanan lan tatao ye hangkan nin kamateyan nin Mangiligtah. Noba aliwan bengat angga ihtew, ta naiholat ha liblon Kakanta a bi-ayen na yan oman Apo Dioh. Ket oli ha pagkamatey boy pagkabi-ay nan oman nin Mangiligtah, nignap anay inihip nan Apo Dioh a kaligtahan nin tao.

God showed the prophets many things about the coming Messiah, but the Messiah had not come yet. More than 400 years after the last of these prophecies was given, when the time was perfect, God sent the Messiah into the world.Ipinakita ng Diyos sa mg propeta ang maraming bagay tungkol sa darating na Tagapagligtas. Pero hindi pa dumarating noon ang Tagapagligtas. Mahigit 400 taon pa ang lumipas bago ipinadala ng Diyos ang Tagapagligtas ng lahat ng tao.Malabong ye impakit nan Apo Dioh kanlan popropita na tongkol ha panlomateng nan Mangiligtah. Maigit anan 400 a taon po ye nalabah bay na ya intobol ye Mangiligtah kanlan tatao ihti ha babe lota.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Genesis 3:15; 12:1-3; Deuteronomy 18:15; 2 Samuel 7; Jeremiah 31; Isaiah 59:16; Daniel 7; Malachi 4:5; Isaiah 7:14; Micah 5:2; Isaiah 9:1-7; 35:3-5; 61; 53; Psalm 22:18; 35:19; 69:4; 41:9; Zechariah 11:12-13; Isaiah 50:6; Psalm 16:10-11
chapters.title: 21. **God Promises the Messiah

frames.text: More than 400 years after the last prophet spoke to the Jews, an angel appeared to an old priest named Zechariah. He was a godly man, but his wife, Elizabeth, could not have any children.Nalabah anay 400 a taon paibat ha kapopohan a propeta nan Apo Dioh. Haanin, main maghay padi a nag-ngalan Zacarias. Matoynong ya ha pamilew nan Apo Dioh noba hiya boy ahawa na a hiyay Elisabet, ahe hila nagkaanak. Ta bawog yay Elisabet boy matoa hilayna.

The angel said to Zechariah, “Your wife will have a son. You will name him John. He will be the great prophet that comes before the Messiah!” Zechariah responded, “My wife and I are too old to have children! How will I know this will happen?”Linomateng ye mangaamot a hiyay golopo nan Zacarias ye maghilbi ha Himbaan nan Apo Dioh.  Ket kapipikhaan main maghay pānobolen nin Dioh a nagpakit kanan Zacarias. Ampideng yayna ha dapit wanan nin pangolaman nin idigalo nan Apo Dioh.  Kaya-bay, naigat yay Zacarias boy nalimwan ya kanan anghel. Noba hinabi nan pānobolen nin Dioh kana, a wana, “Adi ka angkalimo, Zacarias! Ta linnge nan Apo Dioh ye pakigwang mo. Hiyay Elisabet a ahawa mo, manganak ya lanon maghay lākin pangalanan mon Juan. Ket hiya ye maona ha Mangiligtah a lomateng."Haanin, nanepet yay Zacarias kanan pānobolen nin Dioh, a wana, “Way-omon yan malyadi kammi yati, ket padiho kayiynan matoan ahawa ko?”

The angel answered, “I was sent by God to bring you this good news. Because you did not believe me, you will not be able to speak until the child is born.” Immediately, Zechariah was unable to speak. Then the angel left. Zechariah returned home, and his wife became pregnant.Nakibat yay pānobolen nin Dioh kanan Zacarias, a wana, “Hikoy anghel a nag-ngalan Gabriel a lanang ampaghilbi kanan Apo Dioh. Hiyabay ye nangitobol kangkon mangihabi kammo nin yatin manged a balita. Ket yatin imbalita ko kammo, mapaptegan ya lano no maabotan ye panaon. Noba oli ta ahe ka namteg ha hinabi ko, maomel ka. Ahe ka makapaghabi anggan ahe ya lomwah ye anak mo.” Ha linomwah yay Zacarias, ahe yayna makapaghabi kanlan tatao. Ahe naboyot, hiyay Elisabet a ahawa na, binomoktot ya. (Luke 1:19, 22a, 24a)

When Elizabeth was six months pregnant, the same angel appeared to Elizabeth’s relative, whose name was Mary. She was a virgin and was engaged to a man named Joseph. The angel said, “You will become pregnant and give birth to a son.”Ha anem anan bowan ye boktot nan Elisabet, intobol na yan Apo Dioh ye pānobolen na a nag-ngalan Gabriel a makew ha banwan Nazaret ha plobinhyan Galilea.  Intobol na yan makew kanan Maria a maghay balatang a homain po nadihaan a kabaang nan Jose. Haanin, hiyay Gabriel, nakew ya kanan Maria ta hinabi na kana, a wana, “Minged ka! Ta in-ingalowan na kan Apo Dioh. Ket anti yayna kammo.  (Luke 1:26, 27a, 28)

The angel continued, “You are to name him Jesus. He will be the Messiah!” Mary replied, “How can this be, since I am a virgin?” The angel explained, “The Holy Spirit will come over you, and you will conceive. So your son will be called the Son of the Most High God.”<font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff>Hinabi na po nin p</font> ā​nobolen nin Dioh, "<font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff>Lengen</font> mo<font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff></font> ko<font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff>!</font> Manginaw<font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff></font> ka<font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff>boy</font> manganak<font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff></font> ka<font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff></font> lano<font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff></font> nin<font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff></font> maghay<font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff></font> lākin<font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff></font> pangalanan<font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff></font> mon<font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff>Jesus.</font> Maidangal ya boy mahabtan yan ‘Anak nin Pinakamakapalyadiyan a Dioh.’​Haanin, nanepet yay Maria kanan pānobolen nin Dioh, a wana, “Way-omon ako manganak, ket homain po nangahawa kangko?” Nakibat yay pānobolen nin Dioh, a wana, “Hiyay Ihpidito nan Apo Dioh, makew ya kammo. Ket makaoli ha kapalyadiyan nan Bapa a Dioh, bomoktot ka. Kaya-bay hiyay i-anak mo, mahabtan yan Anak nin Dioh. (Luke 1:31-32a,34-35)

Not long after this, Mary went and visited Elizabeth. As soon as Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, Elizabeth’s baby jumped inside her. The women rejoiced together about what God had done for them. After visiting for three months, Mary returned home.Ahe naboyot, ampagpatige yaynay Maria ta makew ya ha baey nan Zacarias boy Elisabet a anti ha matagay a logal ha maghay banwa ha plobinhyan Judea. Legan anhomlep ya kananyatew a baey, hinabi na kanan Elisabet, a wana, “Oh! Komohta kayna?” Ha nange nan Elisabet ye pangomohta nan Maria, ket naggalaw yay ongiꞌ ha loob nin bitoka nan Elisabet. Ket naheb yan Ihpiditon Dioh ye Elisabet. (Luke 1:39-41)

After Elizabeth gave birth to her baby boy, they named him John as the angel commanded. Then God allowed Zechariah to speak again. He said, “Praise God, because He has remembered His people! You, my son, will be called the prophet of the Most High God! You will prepare the way for the Messiah!”Haanin, naabot anay odah nan panganak nan Elisabet. Ket hiyay in-anak na, maghay lāki.​ Impangalan la yan Juan a omon ha hinabi nan panobolen nan Dioh.  Ket kapipikhaan, nakapaghabi yaynan oman ye Zacarias boy nanggalang ya kanan Apo Dioh. Hinabi na, “Galangen yay Apo Dioh a Dioh lan tatao ha Israel.Ta nakew yan mangiligtah kanlan tatao na.Ket hika, anak ko, habtan la kan propita nin Pinakamakapalyadiyan a Dioh.Ta hikay maonan mangihadya nin tatao ha panlomateng na." (Luke 1:57, 64, 68, 76)

Hiyay Maria ket nakataning yan ikahal nan Jose. Noba bayo hila napaylamo, natanam nan Maria, a naboktot ya, oli ha dinyag nan Ihpidito nin Dioh. Hiyay Jose a mangahawa kanan Maria, ket magha yan matoynong a tao. Kaya-bay inihip na a ihyay na yay Maria a homain nagtanda, ta ahe na ya labay a mipading-ey ye Maria.

Noba hiyay Jose, ha an-ihipen na yati, napakit ya kana ye pānobolen nin Dioh ha taynep na. Ket hinabi na kana a, “Jose a apo nan David, adi ka ampaglowa-lowa a mangahawa kanan Maria ta naboktot ya oli ha dinyag nin Ihpidito nin Dioh. Ket manganak yan maghay laki a pangalanan mon Jesus, a ta iligtah na hilay tatao ha kakahalanan la.”
Haanin ha nimata yay Jose, tinopad nay hinabi nin pānobolen nin Dioh kana. Kaya-bay pinag-ahawa na yaynay Maria. Noba ahe naya nilalay ye Maria angga ha ahe ya mianak ye ongi.

Kananyatew a panaon, hiyay Cesar Augusto a pinakamatagay a poon ha Roma, impabalita nay bilin na, a wana, “Impahabi nan Cesar Augusto a moli kawoyna ha hadili yon logal ta omon kawo magpalihta!” Kaya-bay noli hilaynay Jose boy Maria ha banwan Betlehem.

Ha anti hilayna ihtew ha banwan Betlehem, naabot anay panganak nan Maria. Ket namonganay yan maghay lāki. Haanin, linampinan na yay ongiꞌ na ta impaida na ya ha lambangan a panganan nin aayop. Ket ihtew hila kinomonin ha baey nin aayop ta homain hilaynan konaan a baey. Ket pinangalanan la yan Jesus.

Kananyatew a madeglem, main papahtol ha pagpahtolan nin aayop. Ampagpoyat hila. Ta ampanalima hilan totopa la. Haanin, hiyay maghay pānobolen nin Dioh, kapipikhaan napakit ya kanlan papahtol. Ket main henag a ibat ha langit a nakahnag kanla. Kaya-bay nalimwan hilan tobat. Noba naghabi yay pānobolen nin Dioh kanla, a wana, “Hey! Adi kawo angkalimo! Ta nakew ako ihtibay a mangihabi kanyo nin Manged a Balita a makaibiyay nin tobat a kalighaan kanlan kaganaan a tatao. Haanin a madeglem, main nianak ihtew ha banwa nan David. Hiyabay ye Criston Māngiligtah a impangako nan Apo Dioh a Mānakop nin kaganaan."

Yati ye pagkakitan yo ta omon yo ya matandaan. No makakit kawon maghay ongiꞌ a linampinan a nakaida ha lambangan a panganan nin aayop, ket yabaytew yaynay Māngiligtah”, wanan p<font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff>ā</font> nobolen nin Dioh. Kapipikhaan, malabong anay katalig nan kapadiho nan pānobolen nin Dioh a nangibat ha langit. Ket hilay kaganaan a p<font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff>ānobolen</font> <font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff>nin Dioh</font> , naymamagha hilan nanggalang kanan Apo Dioh, a wanla, “Galangen yay Apo Dioh a anti ha langit! Ket ihti ha babe lota, main anan katanaan kanlan tataon anlogoden nan Apo Dioh,” wanlan p<font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff>ānobolen</font> <font 13px/arial;;#000000;;#ffffff>nin Dioh</font> .

Kaya-bay magagah hilan nanige. Ket ha niabot hilayna ha Betlehem, nakit la yay Maria boy Jose a lamo la yay ongiꞌ a ampida ha lambangan a panganan nin aayop. Ha nakit la yay ongiꞌ, imbalita laynay hinabi nin anghel kanla tongkol kana. Ket nagtaka hilay kaganaan a tataon nakange ha hinabi lan papahtol. Haanin, nag-odong hilaynay papahtol ha pagpahtolan la. Ampanggalang hila boy ampandayaw hila kanan Apo Dioh oli ha nange boy nakit la.

Ha maghay mangaamot, linomateng ha Jerusalem hilay mangadonong a lalakin ampangimaton nin tige nan bontatala a nang-ibat ha dapit pihwakan. Haanin, nanepet hila kanan Poon Herodes, “Apo, ha dapit pihwakan a ibatan mi, main kayin nakit a bontatala. Hiyay bontatala ye pagkakitan no way-ihtew yan nianak ye Poon lan Jujudio. Kaya-bay nakew kayi ihti a manepet kammo no way-ihtew ya nianak. Ta makew kayin manggalang kana.” Ha anti hila po ha dān, nakit la yay na man ye bontatala. Ket hinombong lay henag nin bontatala a palakew ha pinangianakan kanan Jesus. Ha linomoob hilayna ha baey nin ayop, nakit la yay anak ha talig nan Maria a indo' na.
Ket nilomokob hilan nanggalang kana boy nilowat lay kakaget la. Ta in-ibiyay la kana ye balitok, insenso, boy pabango a mira.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Matthew 1; Luke 2
chapters.title: 23. The Birth of Jesus

frames.text: Hiyay Juan a anak nan Zacarias, linomake ya boy nag-ilyadi yan propita nan Apo Dioh. Anti ya ha logal a homain tao. Hiyay bado nan Juan ket yadi ha labok nin kamelyo boy hiyay akeh na, yadi met ha katat. Hiyay pamamangan na ket, kowangey boy polot-panilan.

Ket ha anti ya ihtew, intobol na yaynan Apo Dioh a mangiadal kanlan tatao. Kaya-bay hiyay Juan, ampakew yan ampangiadal kanlan tatao ha lologal a mitaligmang a kabatowan nin Jordan. Ket hiyay an-iadal na, wanae ya, “Paghehean yoy kakahalanan yo boy pabawtihmo kawo ta omon na kawon patawaden nin Apo Dioh.”

Malabong a tatao ye nakew kanan Juan ta omen makilenge kana. Inako lay kakahalanan la boy pinaghehean la. Kayabay binawtihmohan na hila ha kabatowan nin Jordan. Noba main met mamaihtodo nin bibilin a nakew nagpabawtihmo agya ahe la inako ye kakahalanan la.

Hinabi na kanla, a wana, “Hikawon lahi lan bibikat! Hinyay naghabi kanyo a makaligtah kawo ha lomateng a pamadoha nan Apo Dioh kanlan tataon makahalanan a ahe ampaghehe? Ahe kawo makaligtah no habi-habin bengat ye paghehe yo!

Hilay tatao, angkahabekan hilaynan ampangagad ha panlomateng nan Cristo a impangako nan Apo Dioh. Ket ampangihip hilayna tongkol kanan Juan, a wanla ha hadili la, “Hiyayna lagi ye Cristo?” Kaya-bay hinabi nan Juan kanla, a wana, “Ampamawtihmo ko ha lanom, noba main lomateng lano a maiigit po ye kapalyadiyan na dinan ko. Agya manlowat bengat nin gawot hapatoh na, ket ahe akon malyadi.
Ha kabekahan, hiyay Juan, ha nakit na yay Apo Jesus a anhomaley kana, ket hinabi na kanlan tatao, a wana, “Bilewen yo! Anti yaynay Kalnilo nin Dioh a mangialih nin kakahalanan lan kaganaan a tatao!

Hinabi nan Juan kanan Apo Jesus, “Aliwan hikoy mamawtihmo kammo. Katapolan a hika ye magbawtihmo kangko.” Noba nakibat yay Apo Jesus kana, “Higiyna, ta yabayti ye kalabayan nan Apo Dioh ket katapolan a madiyag.” Ket haanin, hiyay Apo Jesus, binawtihmowan nayan Juan.

Ha nabawtihmowan nayay Apo Jesus, naglokat yay langit. Ket tampol nayan nakit ye Ihpiditon Dioh a kadih kalapati. Ket dinompa ya kana. Haanin, main tonoy a nang-ibat ha langit a naghabi nin wanae, “Yati ye Anak kon ampakaado-adoen ko boy angkaaliktan kon tobat.”

Hinabi nan Juan a, "Impatanda nin Apo Dioh a nangitobol kangkon mamaotihmo ko ha lanom. Ket wanae ye impatanda nan Apo Dioh kangko, ‘Hiyay taon makit mon aypaan nin Ihpidito, ket hiyabay met ateed ye mamawtihmon Ihpidito nin Dioh.’ ” Hinabi na po nin Juan, a wana, “Nakit kon nalyadi kanan yatin tao ye hinabi nan Apo Dioh. Kaya-bay haanin, an-ipapteg kanyo, a hiyabay peteg a Anak nin Dioh.” Mamaghay Apo Dioh noba anti ya ha tatlon kakadih: Bapa, Anak, boy Ihpidito.
